Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) List protection groups

Displays a list of protection groups, including their associated source arrays, replication targets, hosts count, host groups count, and volumes count. The list includes protection groups that were created on the local array to replicate snapshot data to other arrays or offload targets, created on a remote array and replicated asynchronously to this array, or created inside a pod on a remote array and stretched to the local array.

Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Get-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Servers

List servers

Displays a list of servers.

Get-Pfa2Servers Aliases

  • Get-Pfa2Server

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Servers [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name Names Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a protection group and upsert tags

Creates a protection group on the local array for asynchronous replication. For more information of creating volumes under SafeMode, run `Get-Help About_Pfa2Safemode`

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • New-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing object during an object copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing object, the copy operation fails. Required if the `source` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing object during the copy operation. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds The id of the protection group or protection group snapshot to be copied into a new or existing protection group. If the destination protection group and all of its volumes already exist, include the `Overwrite` parameter to overwrite all of the existing volumes with the snapshot contents. If including the `Overwrite` parameter, the names of the volumes that are being overwritten must match the names of the volumes that are being restored. If the source is a protection group, the latest snapshot of the protection group will be used as the source during the copy operation. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The name of the protection group or protection group snapshot to be copied into a new or existing protection group. If the destination protection group and all of its volumes already exist, include the `Overwrite` parameter to overwrite all of the existing volumes with the snapshot contents. If including the `Overwrite` parameter, the names of the volumes that are being overwritten must match the names of the volumes that are being restored. If the source is a protection group, the latest snapshot of the protection group will be used as the source during the copy operation. false False None
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Servers

Create server

Creates a server on the local array. The server must be given a unique name.

New-Pfa2Servers Aliases

  • New-Pfa2Server

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Servers [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CreateLocalDirectoryService <String>] [-DirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] [-DnsId <List<String>>] [-DnsName <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <String>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <String>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

-DirectoryServiceId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-DirectoryServiceName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None

reference: Reference		 false False None

-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a protection group

Deletes a protection group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated protection groups cannot be recovered. Protection groups are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup` method. The `Name` parameter is required.

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Remove-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete ProtectionGroup false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group

Modifies the protection group schedules to generate and replicate snapshots to another array or to an external storage system. Renames or destroys a protection group.

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Update-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupName <String>] [-ReplicationScheduleAt <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutEnd <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutStart <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-ReplicationScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-RetentionLock <String>] [-SnapshotScheduleAt <Int64>] [-SnapshotScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-SnapshotScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-SourceRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionDays <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPerPeriod <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPeriodLengthMs <Int64>] [-TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionDays <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerPeriod <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPeriodLengthMs <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none Has this protection group been destroyed? To destroy a protection group, patch to `$True`. To recover a destroyed protection group, patch to `$False`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ProtectionGroupName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleAt none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutEnd none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutStart none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleEnabled none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleFrequency none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. The schedule settings for asynchronous replication. false False None
-RetentionLock none (REST API 2.13+) The valid values are `ratcheted` and `unlocked`. The default value for a newly created protection group is `unlocked`. Set `RetentionLock` to `ratcheted` to enable SafeMode restrictions on the protection group. Contact Pure Technical Services to change `RetentionLock` to `unlocked`. false False None
-SnapshotScheduleAt none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. false False None
-SnapshotScheduleEnabled none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. false False None
-SnapshotScheduleFrequency none (REST API 2.3+) The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. false False None
-SourceRetentionAllForSec none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. false False None
-SourceRetentionDays none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. false False None
-SourceRetentionPerDay none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. false False None
-SourceRetentionPerPeriod none The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. false False None
-SourceRetentionPeriodLengthMs none The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionAllForSec none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionDays none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionPerDay none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionPerPeriod none The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionPeriodLengthMs none The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. false False None

-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Connect-Pfa2Array

Connect to an array

Connect to an array (using supported authentication method) and get an access token. For information of setting global PureStoragePowerShellSDK2 options, run `Help about_Pfa2Configuration`.

Syntax 

Connect-Pfa2Array -ApiToken <String> [-ApiVersion <String>] [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-HttpTimeout <Int32>] [-IgnoreCertificateError] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] -ClientId <String> [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-HttpTimeout <Int32>] [-IgnoreCertificateError] -Issuer <String> -KeyId <String> -PrivateKeyFile <String> [-PrivateKeyPassword <SecureString>] -Username <String> [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Credential <PSCredential>] [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-HttpTimeout <Int32>] [-IgnoreCertificateError] -Password <SecureString> [-Username <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] -Credential <PSCredential> [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-HttpTimeout <Int32>] [-IgnoreCertificateError] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiToken none {{ Fill ApiToken Description }} true False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-ClientId none Client ID of the API client that issues the identity token. true False None
-Credential none The credentials for the FlashArray login false False None
-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging none Disables phone home logging of Pure Storage PowerShell SDK activity on the FlashArray false False False
-Endpoint none The FlashArray name or IP address true False None
-HttpTimeout none Sets the timeout value for the HTTP requests for this connection. The default is 30000ms (30 seconds). For information of setting global PureStoragePowerShellSDK2 options, run `Help about_Pfa2Configuration`. false False None
-IgnoreCertificateError none Prevents certificate errors such as an unknown certificate issuer or non-matching names from causing the request to fail. false False False
-Issuer none The name of the identity provider that will be issuing ID Tokens for this API client. This string represents the JWT iss (issuer) claim in ID Tokens issued for this API client. true False None
-KeyId none Key ID of the API client that issues the identity token. true False None
-Password none Password associated with the login name of the array user. true False None
-PrivateKeyFile none Local file path for the PEM encoded private key certificate. true False None
-PrivateKeyPassword none Password, if any, for the PEM encoded private key certificate. false False None
-Username none Login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system. true False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2ActiveDirectory

(REST API 2.3+) List Active Directory accounts

Displays configured Active Directory accounts.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ActiveDirectory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Alert

(REST API 2.2+) List alerts

Displays a list of alerts.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Alert [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Flagged <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Flagged none If set to `$True`, lists only flagged messages. If set to `$False`, lists only unflagged messages. if not specified, lists all messages. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2ArrayCloudProviderTag

(REST API 2.6+) List user tags on the cloud.

Displays the list of user tags on deployed cloud resources of a CBS array.

Syntax

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None

Get-Pfa2ArrayConnection

(REST API 2.4+) List the connected arrays

Displays a list of connected arrays.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArrayConnection [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-RemoteId <List<String>>] [-RemoteName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-RemoteId RemoteIds A list of remote array IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteName` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteName RemoteNames A list of remote array names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteId` query parameter. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2ArrayConnectionKey

(REST API 2.4+) List connection key

Displays the connection key for the array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArrayConnectionKey [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Encrypted <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Encrypted none If `$True`, the returned array connection key will encode an encryption key used to establish trust and secure replication traffic. If `$False`, the returned array connection key will not encode an encryption key. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance

(REST API 2.2+) List array front-end performance data

Displays real-time and historical front-end performance data at the array level including latency, bandwidth, IOPS, average I/O size, and queue depth.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Protocol none Protocol type. Valid values are `nfs`, `smb`, and `all`. false False None
-ProtocolGroup none Protocol group type. Valid values are `block`, `file`, and `all`. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2ArraySpace

(REST API 2.2+) List array space information

Displays real-time and historical array space information including unique volume and snapshot space, shared space, data reduction, provisioned capacity, usable capacity, and parity.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArraySpace [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • None

Outputs

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2ArraysPerformanceByLink

List array front-end IO performance data by link

Displays real-time and historical front-end performance data at the array level including latency, bandwidth, IOPS, average I/O size, and queue depth. Group output is shown by link. A link represents a set of arrays that an I/O operation depends on. For local-only I/Os, this is a local array. For mirrored I/Os, this is a set of synchronous replication peer arrays.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArraysPerformanceByLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2ArrayTag

List tags

Displays the list of tags on array objects.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArrayTag [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Namespace <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Namespace Namespaces A list of namespaces. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None

Get-Pfa2Connection

(REST API 2.0+) List volume connections

Displays a list of connections between a volume and its hosts and host groups, as well as the logical unit numbers (LUNs) or NVMe Namespace IDs (NSIDs) used by the associated hosts to address these volumes.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Connection [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`). false False None
-HostName HostNames Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`). false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointId ProtocolEndpointIds Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. Enter multiple IDs. For example, `peid01,peid02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple protocol endpoint IDs and host names. Instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `ProtocolEndpointId`) must be set to one ID (e.g., `peid01`). false False None
-ProtocolEndpointName ProtocolEndpointNames Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `pe01,pe02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple protocol endpoint names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `ProtocolEndpointName`) must be set to one name (e.g., `pe01`). false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-VolumeId VolumeIds Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time. false False None
-VolumeName VolumeNames Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`). false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value

-Id Ids Performs the operation on the container ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Specifying `Id` or `Name` with no value will perform the operation on local array. false False None
