Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance

(REST API 2.0+) List host group performance data

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes of all host groups, displayed both by host group and by total size across all host groups. This data represents volumes that are connected to the host groups on the local array and stretched volumes connected to the host groups on arrays that are connected by synchronous replication.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray

(REST API 2.0+) List host group performance data by array

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data is displayed by total size across all host groups on each array and by individual host group on each array. The displayed data represents the volumes that are connected to a host group on the current array and the volumes that are connected to a host group on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) List host groups that are members of protection groups

Displays a list of host group members that belong to one or more protection groups.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2HostGroupSpace

(REST API 2.1+) List host group space information

Displays provisioned size and physical storage consumption data for each host group.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupSpace [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None

Get-Pfa2HostGroupTag

List tags

Displays the list of tags on host group objects.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupTag [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Namespace <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ResourceDestroyed <Boolean>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Namespace Namespaces A list of namespaces. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-ResourceDestroyed none If set to `$True`, returns only objects from destroyed resources. Returns an error if the name of a live resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. If set to `$False`, returns only objects from live resources. Returns an error if the name of a destroyed resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Get-Pfa2HostPerformance

(REST API 2.0+) List host performance data

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes across all hosts, displayed by host and by total size across all hosts. This data represents volumes that are connected to the hosts on the local array and stretched volumes connected to the hosts on any arrays that are connected by synchronous replication.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostPerformance [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray

(REST API 2.0+) List host performance data by array

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data is displayed by total size across all hosts on each array and by individual host on each array. The displayed data represents the volumes that are connected to a host on the current array and the volumes that are connected to a host on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None

If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None

-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2HostTag

List tags

Displays the list of tags on host objects.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostTag [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Namespace <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ResourceDestroyed <Boolean>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Namespace Namespaces A list of namespaces. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-ResourceDestroyed none If set to `$True`, returns only objects from destroyed resources. Returns an error if the name of a live resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. If set to `$False`, returns only objects from live resources. Returns an error if the name of a destroyed resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

Get-Pfa2NetworkInterfacePerformance

(REST API 2.4+) List network performance statistics

Displays network statistics, historical bandwidth, and error reporting for all specified network interfaces.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2NetworkInterfacePerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Pod

(REST API 2.1+) List pods

Displays a list of pods that are stretched to this array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Pod [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None

Get-Pfa2PodArray

(REST API 2.1+) List pods and their the array members

Displays a list of pods and the local and remote arrays over which the pods are stretched. Pods with realm members will not be returned. The optional `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the pod. The optional `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array over which the pod is stretched. (Deprecated) Use pods/members instead.)

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2PodArray [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2PodPerformance

(REST API 2.1+) List pod performance data

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes across all pods, displayed both by pod and as a total across all pods.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2PodPerformance [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Protocol none (REST API 2.13+) Protocol type. Valid values are `nfs`, `smb`, and `all`. false False None
-ProtocolGroup none (REST API 2.13+) Protocol group type. Valid values are `block`, `file`, and `all`. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceByArray

(REST API 2.1+) List pod performance data by array

Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data is displayed as a total across all pods on the local array and by individual pod.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceByArray [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Protocol none (REST API 2.13+) Protocol type. Valid values are `nfs`, `smb`, and `all`. false False None
-ProtocolGroup none (REST API 2.13+) Protocol group type. Valid values are `block`, `file`, and `all`. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceReplication

(REST API 2.2+) List pod replication performance data

Displays pod replication performance data. The data returned is the real-time and historical performance data for each replication type at the pod level. Values include `continuous`, `periodic`, `resync`, and `sync`.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceReplication [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceReplicationByArray

(REST API 2.2+) List pod replication performance data by array

Displays pod replication performance data, organized by array. The data returned is the real-time and historical performance data for each replication type at the pod level. Values include `continuous`, `periodic`, `resync`, and `sync`.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceReplicationByArray [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
