If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2VolumeTag

(REST API 2.2+) List tags

Displays the list of tags.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2VolumeTag [-AllowError <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Namespace <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ResourceDestroyed <Boolean>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowError AllowErrors If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Filter none {{ Fill Filter Description }} false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Namespace Namespaces A list of namespaces. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-ResourceDestroyed none If set to `$True`, returns only objects from destroyed resources. Returns an error if the name of a live resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. If set to `$False`, returns only objects from live resources. Returns an error if the name of a destroyed resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Outputs

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names. false False None

Invoke-Pfa2CLICommand

Syntax

Invoke-Pfa2CLICommand -CommandText <String> -EndPoint <String> [-IgnoreCertificateError] -Password <SecureString> [-TimeOutInMilliSeconds <Int32>] -UserName <String> [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-CommandText none The CLI command to run on the FlashArray true False None
-Credential none The credentials for SSH access to the FlashArray true True (ByValue) None
-EndPoint none The management address of the FlashArray true True (ByPropertyName) None
-IgnoreCertificateError none Prevents certificate errors such as an unknown certificate issuer or non-matching names from causing the request to fail. false False False
-Password none The SSH password for the FlashArray true False None
-TimeOutInMilliSeconds none Timeout in milliseconds false False None
-UserName none The SSH username for the FlashArray true False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False

New-Pfa2ActiveDirectory

(REST API 2.3+) Create Active Directory account

Creates one or more Active Directory accounts. The `User` and `Password` provided are used to join the array to the specified `Domain`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ActiveDirectory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ComputerName <String>] [-DirectoryServer <List<String>>] [-Domain <String>] [-JoinExistingAccount <Boolean>] [-JoinOu <String>] [-KerberosServer <List<String>>] -Name <String> [-Password <SecureString>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Tls <String>] [-User <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ComputerName none The name of the computer account to be created in the Active Directory domain. If not specified, defaults to the name of the Active Directory configuration. false False None
-DirectoryServer DirectoryServers A list of directory servers used for lookups related to user authorization. Servers must be specified in FQDN format. All specified servers must be registered to the domain appropriately in the configured DNS of the array and are only communicated with over the secure LDAP (LDAPS) protocol. If not specified, servers are resolved for the domain in DNS. false False None
-Domain none The Active Directory domain to join. false False None
-JoinExistingAccount none (REST API 2.15+) If specified as `$True`, the domain is searched for a pre-existing computer account to join to, and no new account will be created within the domain. The `User` specified when joining a pre-existing account must have permissions to 'read all properties from' and 'reset the password of' the pre-existing account. `JoinOu` will be read from the pre-existing account and cannot be specified when joining to an existing account. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-JoinOu none (REST API 2.8+) The distinguished name of the organizational unit in which the computer account should be created when joining the domain. The `DC=...` components of the distinguished name can be optionally omitted. If not specified, defaults to `CN=Computers`. false False None
-KerberosServer KerberosServers A list of key distribution servers to use for Kerberos protocol. Servers must be specified in FQDN format. All specified servers must be registered to the domain appropriately in the configured DNS of the array. If not specified, servers are resolved for the domain in DNS. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Password none The login password of the user with privileges to create the computer account in the domain. This is not persisted on the array. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-Tls none (REST API 2.15+) TLS mode for communication with domain controllers. Valid values are `required` and `optional`. `required` forces TLS communication with a domain controller. `optional` allows the use of non-TLS communication, TLS will still be preferred, if available. If not specified, defaults to `required`. false False None
-User none The login name of the user with privileges to create the computer account in the domain. This is not persisted on the array. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ManagementAccessPoliciesName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ManagementAccessPoliciesResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Password none Password associated with the account. false False None

-Parameter none The parameter of the custom alert rule to modify. Values include `info` and `warning`. Available parameter values can be found in the alert rules catalog. true False None
-Value none The value to use for the custom alert rule. Valid values for an alert code and parameter combination can be found in the alert rules catalog. false False None

-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None

-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

New-Pfa2ApiClient

(REST API 2.1+) Create an API client

Creates an API client. Newly created API clients are disabled by default. Enable an API client through the `Update-Pfa2ApiClient` method. The `Name`, `Issuer`, and `PublicKey` parameters are required. The `access_policies` or `MaxRole` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ApiClient [-AccessPoliciesId <List<String>>] [-AccessPoliciesName <List<String>>] [-AccessPoliciesResourceType <List<String>>] [-AccessTokenTtlInMs <Int64>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Issuer <String>] [-MaxRole <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PublicKey <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AccessPoliciesId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-AccessPoliciesName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-AccessPoliciesResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-AccessTokenTtlInMs none The TTL (Time To Live) length of time for the exchanged access token. Measured in milliseconds. If not specified, defaults to `86400000`. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Issuer none The name of the identity provider that will be issuing ID Tokens for this API client. The `iss` claim in the JWT issued must match this string. If not specified, defaults to the API client name. false False None
-MaxRole none Deprecated. The maximum Admin Access Policy (previously 'role') allowed for ID Tokens issued by this API client. The bearer of an access token will be authorized to perform actions within the intersection of this policy and that of the array user specified as the JWT `sub` (subject) claim. `MaxRole` is deprecated in favor of `access_policies`, but remains for backwards compatibility. If `MaxRole` is the name of a valid legacy role, it will be interpreted as the corresponding access policy of the same name. Otherwise, it's invalid. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PublicKey none The API client's PEM formatted (Base64 encoded) RSA public key. Include the `-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----` and `-----END PUBLIC KEY-----` lines. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ArrayAuth

Create an API Client

Create an API Client registration on an array for OAuth2 authentication

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ArrayAuth [-AccessTokenTtlMilliSeconds <Int64>] -ApiClientName <String> -Credential <PSCredential> -Endpoint <String> [-Force] -Issuer <String> [-MaxRole <String>] [-SshPublicKeyResponseTimeoutInMilliseconds <Int64>] [-SshPublicKeyTimeoutMilliseonds <Int64>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2ArrayAuth [-AccessTokenTtlMilliSeconds <Int64>] -ApiClientName <String> -Endpoint <String> [-Force] -Issuer <String> [-MaxRole <String>] -Password <SecureString> [-SshPublicKeyResponseTimeoutInMilliseconds <Int64>] [-SshPublicKeyTimeoutMilliseonds <Int64>] -Username <String> [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AccessTokenTtlMilliSeconds none Access token time-to-live duration, in milliseconds. false False None
-ApiClientName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and cannot be changed. true False None
-Credential none The credentials for the FlashArray login. true True (ByValue) None
-Endpoint none The FlashArray name or IP address. true False None
-Force none Overwrites an existing ApiClient on the FlashArray if certificates are not found on the local machine. false False False
-Issuer none The name of the identity provider that will be issuing ID Tokens for this API client. This string represents the JWT iss (issuer) claim in ID Tokens issued for this API client. true False None
-MaxRole none The maximum role allowed for ID Tokens issued by this API client. The bearer of an access token will be authorized to perform actions within the intersection of this MaxRole and the role of the array user specified as the JWT sub (subject) claim. Valid max_role values are readonly, ops_admin, array_admin, and storage_admin. Users with the readonly (Read Only) role can perform operations that convey the state of the array. Read Only users cannot alter the state of the array. Users with the ops_admin (Ops Admin) role can perform the same operations as Read Only users plus enable and disable remote assistance sessions. Ops Admin users cannot alter the state of the array. Users with the storage_admin (Storage Admin) role can perform the same operations as Read Only users plus storage related operations, such as administering volumes, hosts, and host groups. Storage Admin users cannot perform operations that deal with global and system configurations. Users with the array_admin (Array Admin) role can perform the same operations as Storage Admin users plus array-wide changes dealing with global and system configurations. In other words, Array Admin users can perform all operations. false False None
-Password none Password associated with the login name of the array user. true False None
-SshPublicKeyResponseTimeoutInMilliseconds none Time to wait for response or error from pureapiclient create. Default is 1000ms false False None
-SshPublicKeyTimeoutMilliseonds none Time to wait for the "Please enter public key" prompt from ssh. Default is 5000ms false False None
-Username none Login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system. true False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.Management.Automation.PSCredential

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • PureStorage.Rest.PureApiClientAuthInfo

New-Pfa2ArrayConnection

(REST API 2.4+) Create an array connection

Creates a connection between this array and the specified array.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ArrayConnection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ConnectionKey <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Encryption <String>] [-ManagementAddress <String>] [-ReplicationAddress <List<String>>] [-ReplicationTransport <String>] [-Type <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ConnectionKey none The connection key of the target array. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Encryption none If `encrypted`, all traffic over this array connection will be encrypted. If `unencrypted`, all traffic over this array connection will be unencrypted. Defaults to `unencrypted`. false False None
-ManagementAddress none Management IP address of the target array. false False None
-ReplicationAddress ReplicationAddresses IP addresses and FQDNs of the target arrays. Configurable only when `ReplicationTransport` is set to `ip`. If not configured, will be set to all the replication addresses available on the target array at the time of the New-Pfa2ArrayConnection. false False None
-ReplicationTransport none The protocol used to transport data between the local array and the remote array. Valid values are `ip` and `fc`. The default is `ip`. false False None
-Type none The type of replication. Valid values are `async-replication` and `sync-replication`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ArrayFactoryResetToken

(REST API 2.4+) Create a factory reset token

Creates a token that can be used to perform a factory reset on the array. Factory reset tokens can only be created after the array has been prepared for reset (e.g., all volumes and snapshots must first be eradicated). After a token has been created, operations that would take the array out of the prepared state are disabled (e.g., creating volumes) until all tokens have been deleted.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ArrayFactoryResetToken [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Certificate

(REST API 2.4+) Create certificate

Creates a certificate object and specifies the valid time period and organization details of the certificate. A certificate can be imported or manually configured.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Certificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Certificate <String>] [-CommonName <String>] [-Country <String>] [-Days <Int32>] [-Email <String>] [-IntermediateCertificate <String>] [-Key <String>] [-KeyAlgorithm <String>] [-KeySize <Int32>] [-Locality <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Organization <String>] [-OrganizationalUnit <String>] [-Passphrase <String>] [-State <String>] [-SubjectAlternativeNames <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Certificate none The text of the certificate. false False None
-CommonName none The common name field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Country none Two-letter country (ISO) code listed in the certificate. false False None
-Days none The number of days that the self-signed certificate is valid. Defaults to 3650. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate. false False None
-Email none The email field listed in the certificate. false False None
-IntermediateCertificate none The text of the intermediate certificate chains. false False None
-Key Keys The text of the private key. This field can only be specified when importing a certificate and key pair. false False None
-KeyAlgorithm none The key algorithm used to generate the certificate. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate. Defaults to rsa if not specified. Valid values when creating a new self-signed certificate only include `rsa`, `ec`, `ed448` and `ed25519`. false False None
-KeySize none The size (in bits) of the private key for the certificate. Default is 2048 bits for `rsa` key_algorithm, 256 for `ec` and `ed25519`. The `ed448` default key size is 456. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate. false False None
-Locality none The locality field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Organization none The organization field listed in the certificate. false False None
-OrganizationalUnit none The organizational unit field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Passphrase none The passphrase used to encrypt `Key`. This field can only be specified when importing a certificate and key pair. false False None
-State none The state/province field listed in the certificate. false False None
-SubjectAlternativeNames none The alternative names that are secured by this certificate. Alternative names may be IP addresses, DNS names, or URIs. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

-CommonName none The common name field listed in the certificate. false False None

-Email none The email field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Locality none The locality field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Organization none The organization field listed in the certificate. false False None
-OrganizationalUnit none The organizational unit field listed in the certificate. false False None

New-Pfa2Connection

(REST API 2.0+) Create a connection between a volume and host or host group

Creates a connection between a volume and a host or host group. One of `VolumeName` or `VolumeId` and one of `HostName` or `HostGroupName` query parameters are required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Connection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-Lun <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <String>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <String>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`). false False None
-HostName HostNames Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`). false False None
-Lun none The logical unit number (LUN) by which the specified hosts are to address the specified volume. If the LUN is not specified, the system automatically assigns a LUN to the connection. To automatically assign a LUN to a private connection, the system starts at LUN `1` and counts up to the maximum LUN `4095`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection. For shared connections, the system starts at LUN `254` and counts down to the minimum LUN `1`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection. If all LUNs in the `[1...254]` range are taken, the system starts at LUN `255` and counts up to the maximum LUN `4095`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection. Should not be used together with an NVMe host or host group.


minimum: 1


maximum: 4095		 false False None
-ProtocolEndpointId ProtocolEndpointIds (REST API 2.3+) A protocol endpoint (also known as a conglomerate volume) which acts as a proxy through which virtual volumes are created and then connected to VMware ESXi hosts or host groups. The protocol endpoint itself does not serve I/Os; instead, its job is to form connections between FlashArray volumes and ESXi hosts and host groups. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointName ProtocolEndpointNames (REST API 2.3+) A protocol endpoint (also known as a conglomerate volume) which acts as a proxy through which virtual volumes are created and then connected to VMware ESXi hosts or host groups. The protocol endpoint itself does not serve I/Os; instead, its job is to form connections between FlashArray volumes and ESXi hosts and host groups. false False None
-VolumeId VolumeIds Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time. false False None
-VolumeName VolumeNames Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`). false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Directory

(REST API 2.3+) Create directory

Creates a managed directory at the specified path. The managed directory name must consist of a file system name prefix and a managed directory name suffix (separated with ':'). The suffix must be between 1 and 63 characters (alphanumeric and '-') in length and begin and end with a letter or number. The suffix must include at least one letter or '-'. Set `Name` to create a managed directory with the specified full managed directory name, or set `FileSystemName` or `FileSystemId` in the query parameters and `suffix` in the body parameters to create a managed directory in the specified file system with the specified suffix. These two options are exclusive.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Directory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <String>] [-FileSystemId <List<String>>] [-FileSystemName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Path <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames The managed directory name without the file system name prefix. A full managed directory name is constructed in the form of `FILE_SYSTEM:DIR` where `FILE_SYSTEM` is the file system name and `DIR` is the value of this field. `DirectoryName` is required if `FileSystemName` or `FileSystemId` is set. `DirectoryName` cannot be set if `Name` is set. false False None
-FileSystemId FileSystemIds Performs the operation on the file system ID specified. Enter multiple file system IDs. The `FileSystemId` or `FileSystemName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-FileSystemName FileSystemNames Performs the operation on the file system name specified. Enter multiple file system names. For example, `filesystem01,filesystem02`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Path none Path of the managed directory in the file system. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2DirectoryExport

(REST API 2.3+) Create directory exports

Creates an export of a managed directory. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. When server reference is not provided, the `_array_server` is set as effective default. The API provides two options for identifying an export object. One option is to reference it by its fully qualified export name, or alternatively, by a combination of parametersspecifically, the `server` and `ExportName`. All identifying parameters must always be provided, either explicitly or as part of the fully qualified name.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryExport [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-ExportEnabled <Boolean>] [-ExportName <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-ServerId <String>] [-ServerName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DirectoryId DirectoryIds Performs the operation on the unique managed directory IDs specified. Enter multiple managed directory IDs. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `fs:dir01,pod01::fs:dir01`. false False None
-ExportEnabled none Indicates whether the export is enabled. If set to `$True`, the export is enabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-ExportName ExportNames The name of the export to create. Export names must be unique within the same protocol and server. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. Combines the export containment hierarchy (server), the protocol (smb or nfs) and the export_name. For example, `server01::smb::export01,server01::nfs::export01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `policy01,pod01::policy01`. false False None
-ServerId ServerIds Server to which the directory export is attached to. false False None
-ServerName ServerNames Server to which the directory export is attached to. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2DirectoryLockNlmReclamation

Create NLM reclamation

Creates an NLM reclamation, which is a system-wide operation that affects all clients, so only one may be in progress at a time. Attempting to initiate reclamation while one is in progress will result in an error. When NLM reclamation is initiated, all NLM locks are deleted and client applications are notified that they can reacquire their locks within a grace period.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryLockNlmReclamation [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Syntax

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

reference: Reference		 false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyNfs

(REST API 2.3+) Create a membership between a directory and one or more NFS policies

Creates a membership between a directory and one or more NFS policies. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyNfs [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-PolicyExportEnabled <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-PolicyExportName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-PolicyServerId <List<String>>] [-PolicyServerName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyExportEnabled PoliciesExportEnabled If set to `$True`, the export is enabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: DirectorypolicyexportpostPolicies		 false False None
-PolicyExportName PoliciesExportName The name of the export to create when applying the export policy to the directory.


reference: DirectorypolicyexportpostPolicies		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyServerId PoliciesServerId A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None

reference: Reference		 false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyQuota

(REST API 2.7+) Create a membership between a directory and one or more quota policies

Creates a membership between a directory and one or more quota policies. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicySmb

(REST API 2.3+) Create a membership between a directory and one or more SMB policies

Creates a membership between a directory and one or more SMB policies. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicySmb [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-PolicyExportEnabled <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-PolicyExportName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-PolicyServerId <List<String>>] [-PolicyServerName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyExportEnabled PoliciesExportEnabled If set to `$True`, the export is enabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: DirectorypolicyexportpostPolicies		 false False None
-PolicyExportName PoliciesExportName The name of the export to create when applying the export policy to the directory.


reference: DirectorypolicyexportpostPolicies		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyServerId PoliciesServerId A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyServerName PoliciesServerName The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyUserGroupQuota

Create a membership between a directory and one or more user-group-quota policies

Creates a membership between a directory and one or more user-group-quota policies. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyUserGroupQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for user-group-quota management operations. If set to `$True`, user/group usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` of user-group-quota rules. If set to `$False`, the impact of the user-group-quota operation is checked against the user/group usage in the managed directory and its ancestors and the operation is not allowed if the user/group usage would exceed any enforced user-group-quota limits. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryService

Create directory services configuration

Creates directory services configuration. All directory services configuration created using this resource will have `services` set to `data`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryService [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-BaseDn <String>] [-BindPassword <String>] [-BindUser <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] -Name <String> [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Uri <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-BaseDn none Base of the Distinguished Name (DN) of the directory service groups. false False None
-BindPassword none Masked password used to query the directory. false False None
-BindUser none Username used to query the directory. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none The directory service is either enabled or disabled. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-Uri Uris List of URIs for the configured directory servers. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalDirectoryService

Create local directory service

Creates a local directory service.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalDirectoryService [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Domain <String>] -Name <String> [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Domain none The name of the domain stored in this local directory service. All users and groups are going to be presented as being part of this domain name. When not set, it defaults to name of the Local Directory Service. For example, for object "mydomain" the domain name will be "mydomain" where domain name does not have any unique constraint (it can be the same for different local directory services within an array. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroup

Create local group

Creates a local group.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Email <String>] [-Gid <Int32>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] -Name <String> [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Email none Optional field to set the email address of the local group. false False None
-Gid none Optional field to set the GID of the local group. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceId LocalDirectoryServiceIds Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceName LocalDirectoryServiceNames Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroupMember

Create local group membership

Creates a local group membership with a group. The `GroupName`, `GroupSid`, or `GroupGid` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroupMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupGid <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-GroupSid <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupGid GroupGids Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the group names specified. Enter multiple group names. For example, `group1,group2`. false False None
-GroupSid GroupSids Performs the operation on the specified group SID. Enter multiple group SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceId LocalDirectoryServiceIds Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceName LocalDirectoryServiceNames Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUser

Create local user

Creates a local user.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUser [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Email <String>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] -Name <String> [-Password <SecureString>] [-PrimaryGroupId <String>] [-PrimaryGroupName <String>] [-PrimaryGroupResourceType <String>] [-Uid <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Email none Optional field to set the email of the local user. false False None
-Enabled none If this field is `$False`, the local user will be disabled on creation. Otherwise, the local user will be enabled and functional. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceId LocalDirectoryServiceIds Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceName LocalDirectoryServiceNames Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Password none The password of the local user. This field is only required if the `Enabled` field is `$True`. false False None
-PrimaryGroupId none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-PrimaryGroupName none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-PrimaryGroupResourceType none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-Uid Uids Optional field to set the UID of the local user. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUserMember

Create local user membership

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUserMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupGid <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-GroupResourceType <List<String>>] [-IsPrimary <Boolean>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberSid <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupGid GroupGids The group GID that should be mapped.


reference: LocalusermembershippostGroups		 false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-GroupName GroupNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-GroupResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-IsPrimary none Determines whether memberships are primary group memberships or not. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceId LocalDirectoryServiceIds Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceName LocalDirectoryServiceNames Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique local member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. For local group IDs refer to group IDs (GID). For local user IDs refer to user IDs (UID). The `MemberId` and `MemberName` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberSid MemberSids Performs the operation on the specified member SID. Enter multiple member SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None

-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole

Create a group in management access policy mappings

Creates one or more groups in management access policy mappings.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Group <String>] [-GroupBase <String>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesId <List<String>>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesName <List<String>>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesResourceType <List<String>>] -Name <String> [-RoleName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Group none Group name that contains users with the abilities granted by the associated policies. false False None
-GroupBase none Specifies where the configured group is located in the directory tree. false False None
-ManagementAccessPoliciesId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ManagementAccessPoliciesName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ManagementAccessPoliciesResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique names specified. For example, `GroupRoleMappingName`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-RoleName RoleNames This field has been deprecated. Predecessor to management access policies. Can be set to the premade policy of the same name. Cannot be set with management_access_policies. false False None

-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None
