New-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) Create directory snapshot

Creates a snapshot of the contents of a directory. The `SourceId` or `SourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ClientName <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-KeepFor <Int64>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ClientName none The client name portion of the client visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the value of this field, and `SUFFIX` is the suffix. The client visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-KeepFor none The time to keep the snapshots for, in milliseconds. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Suffix none (REST API 2.4+) The suffix portion of the client visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the client name, and `SUFFIX` is the value of this field. The client visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. If not specified, defaults to a monotonically increasing number generated by the system. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Dns

(REST API 2.15+) Create DNS configuration

Creates new DNS configuration with parameters including the domain suffix, the list of DNS name server IP addresses, and the list of services that DNS parameters apply to.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Dns [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CaCertificateGroupId <String>] [-CaCertificateGroupName <String>] [-CaCertificateGroupResourceType <String>] [-CaCertificateId <String>] [-CaCertificateName <String>] [-CaCertificateResourceType <String>] [-Domain <String>] [-Name <String>] [-NameServer <List<String>>] [-Service <List<String>>] [-SourceName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CaCertificateGroupId none A reference to the `certificate group` to use for validating nameservers with HTTPS connections. This property is mutually exclusive with `ca_certificate` property and may only be configured when nameservers begin with HTTPS. false False None
-CaCertificateGroupName none A reference to the `certificate group` to use for validating nameservers with HTTPS connections. This property is mutually exclusive with `ca_certificate` property and may only be configured when nameservers begin with HTTPS. false False None
-CaCertificateGroupResourceType none A reference to the `certificate group` to use for validating nameservers with HTTPS connections. This property is mutually exclusive with `ca_certificate` property and may only be configured when nameservers begin with HTTPS. A reference to the `certificate group` to use for validating nameservers with HTTPS connections. This property is mutually exclusive with `ca_certificate` property and may only be configured when nameservers begin with HTTPS. false False None
-CaCertificateId none A reference to the `certificate` to use for validating nameservers with HTTPS connections. This property is mutually exclusive with `ca_certificate_group` property and may only be configured when nameservers begin with HTTPS. false False None
-CaCertificateName none A reference to the `certificate` to use for validating nameservers with HTTPS connections. This property is mutually exclusive with `ca_certificate_group` property and may only be configured when nameservers begin with HTTPS. false False None
-CaCertificateResourceType none A reference to the `certificate` to use for validating nameservers with HTTPS connections. This property is mutually exclusive with `ca_certificate_group` property and may only be configured when nameservers begin with HTTPS. A reference to the `certificate` to use for validating nameservers with HTTPS connections. This property is mutually exclusive with `ca_certificate_group` property and may only be configured when nameservers begin with HTTPS. false False None
-Domain none The domain suffix to be appended by the appliance when performing DNS lookups. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-NameServer Nameservers The list of DNS servers either in the form of IP addresses or HTTPS endpoints. Domain names in HTTPS endpoints are not supported. IP addresses must be used instead. If nameservers begin with `https://`, then DNS queries will be performed over HTTPS. Otherwise, unencrypted DNS queries will be performed. Using a combination of nameservers that begin with `https://` and that do not begin with `https://` is not supported. If servers are specified with `https://` one of `ca_certificate` and `ca_certificate_group` parameters must be set. false False None
-Service Services The list of services utilizing the DNS configuration. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The network interface used for communication with the DNS server. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Files

Create a file copy

Creates a file copy from one path to another path. The `DirectoryId`, `DirectoryName` or `Paths` value must be specified. If the `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` value is not specified, the file is copied to the source directory specified in the body params. The `Paths` value refers to the path of the target file relative to the target directory. If `Paths` value is not specified, the file will be copied to the relative path specified in `SourcePath` under the target directory. The `SourcePath` value refers to the path of the source file relative to the source directory. To overwrite an existing file, set the `Overwrite` flag to `$True`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Files [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-Paths <List<String>>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-SourcePath <String>] [-SourceResourceType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-DirectoryId DirectoryIds Performs the operation on the unique managed directory IDs specified. Enter multiple managed directory IDs. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. For example, `fs:dir01,fs:dir02`. false False None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing object during an object copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing object, the copy operation fails. Required if the `source` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing object during the copy operation. false False None
-Paths none Target file path relative to the target directory. Enter multiple target file path in a comma-separated format. For example, `/dir1/dir2/file1,/dir3/dir4/file2`. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds The source information of a file copy. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The source information of a file copy. false False None
-SourcePath none The source file path relative to the source directory. false False None
-SourceResourceType none The source information of a file copy. The source information of a file copy. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

New-Pfa2Fleet

Create a fleet

Creates a fleet and adds the current array as its first member. Additional arrays can be added to the fleet with `New-Pfa2Fleet /fleets/members`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Fleet [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique resource names specified. Only one value is supported. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2FleetKey

Create a fleet key

Creates a fleet key allowing an array to be added to a fleet. This is the only time the fleet key is displayed, it cannot be retrieved subsequently. Note, creation of a subsequent key invalidates all keys created earlier.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2FleetKey [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2FleetMember

Add members to a fleet

Adds arrays to an existing fleet. This API needs to be run from the array that's joining the fleet. To add the current array to the fleet, specify its own array `MemberId` or `MemberName`, as well as the `fleet key` generated on any array already in the fleet. `MemberResourceType` is `remote-arrays`. The array's `ID` and `MemberName` can be retrieved with a call to `Get-Pfa2FleetMember /arrays` on the array.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2FleetMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-FleetId <List<String>>] [-FleetName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberKey <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-FleetId FleetIds Performs the operation on the unique Fleet IDs specified. This query currently accepts only 1 ID. false False None
-FleetName FleetNames Performs the operation on the unique Fleet names specified. This query currently accepts only 1 name. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: FleetmemberpostMember		 false False None
-MemberKey MembersKey Provide the `fleet key` generated from any array in the fleet.


reference: FleetmemberpostMembers		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name.


reference: FleetmemberpostMember		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (e.g. remote-arrays)


reference: FleetmemberpostMember		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Host

(REST API 2.0+) Create a host and upsert tags

Creates a host for which the `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Host [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ChapHostPassword <String>] [-ChapHostUser <String>] [-ChapTargetPassword <String>] [-ChapTargetUser <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Iqn <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Nqn <List<String>>] [-Personality <String>] [-PreferredArraysId <List<String>>] [-PreferredArraysName <List<String>>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-Vlan <String>] [-Wwn <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ChapHostPassword none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapHostUser none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapTargetPassword none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapTargetUser none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Iqn Iqns The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Nqn Nqns The NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Personality none Determines how the system tunes the array to ensure that it works optimally with the host. Set `Personality` to the name of the host operating system or virtual memory system. Valid values are `aix`, `esxi`, `hitachi-vsp`, `hpux`, `oracle-vm-server`, `solaris`, and `vms`. If your system is not listed as one of the valid host personalities, do not set the option. By default, the personality is not set. false False None
-PreferredArraysId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PreferredArraysName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-Vlan none The VLAN ID that the host is associated with. If not set or set to `any`, the host can access any VLAN. If set to `untagged`, the host can only access untagged VLANs. If set to a number between `1` and `4094`, the host can only access the specified VLAN with that number. false False None
-Wwn Wwns The Fibre Channel World Wide Name (WWN) associated with the host. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2HostGroupHost

(REST API 2.1+) Create a membership to a host group

Create a membership between a host and a host group. Adding a membership to a host group automatically connects the host to all volumes associated with the group. Multiple hosts can be belong to a host group, but a host can only belong to one host group. Hosts can be added to host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2HostGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a host group

Creates a host group member and assigns to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Creates a membership to a host group. Creating a membership to a host group automatically connects the host to all volumes associated with the group. Multiple hosts can be belong to a host group, but a host can only belong to one host group. Hosts can be added to host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None

New-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a host

Creates a host member and adds it to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None

New-Pfa2Login

(REST API 2.0+) Exchange an API token for a session token.

Creates a user session and returns a session token, using either the user's API token or their username and password. `ApiToken` is passed in a header, with the request body empty. Otherwise `Username` and `Password` are passed in the request body, without an `ApiToken` header. Storing user passwords client-side is not recommended. The username-password authentication option should only be used as necessary for initial retrieval of an API token, which should be securely stored and used for all subsequent logins.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Login [-ApiToken <String>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Password <SecureString>] [-Username <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiToken none API token for a user. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Password none The user password that is used as an alternative to an api-token. false False None
-Username none The username used to log in as an alternative to an api-token. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Invalidate a session token.

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-XAuthToken none Session token for a user. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Outputs

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2MaintenanceWindow

(REST API 2.2+) Create a maintenance window

Creates a maintenance window that suppresses alerts for a specified period of time. A maintenance window can be manually closed at any time. The `Name` and `Timeout` parameters are required. Set the `Name` parameter to `environment`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2MaintenanceWindow [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-Timeout <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Timeout none The specified length of time that alerts are suppressed during a maintenance window, measured in milliseconds. The maintenance window timeout value must be between `60000` (1 minute) and `86400000` (24 hours). The value entered is rounded down to the nearest minute. The `Name` and `Timeout` parameters must be set together, and the `Name` parameter must be set to `environment`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

reference: Reference		 false False None
-AttachedServerName AttachedServersName The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-EthAddress none Ethernet network interface properties. Ethernet network interface properties. false False None
-EthSubinterfaceName EthSubinterfacesNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceNoId		 false False None
-EthSubnetName none Ethernet network interface properties. Ethernet network interface properties. false False None
-EthSubtype none Ethernet network interface properties. Ethernet network interface properties. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Service Services The services provided by the specified network interface or Fibre Channel port. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2Offload

(REST API 2.1+) Create offload target

Creates an offload target, connecting it to an array. Before you can connect to, manage, and replicate to an offload target, the Purity Run app must be installed.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Offload [-AmazonS3AccessKeyId <String>] [-AmazonS3AuthRegion <String>] [-AmazonS3Bucket <String>] [-AmazonS3PlacementStrategy <String>] [-AmazonS3Profile <String>] [-AmazonS3SecretAccessKey <String>] [-AmazonS3Uri <String>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-AzureAccountName <String>] [-AzureContainerName <String>] [-AzureProfile <String>] [-AzureSecretAccessKey <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GoogleCloudAccessKeyId <String>] [-GoogleCloudBucket <String>] [-GoogleCloudProfile <String>] [-GoogleCloudSecretAccessKey <String>] [-Initialize <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-NfsAddress <String>] [-NfsMountOptions <String>] [-NfsMountPoint <String>] [-NfsProfile <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2Pod

(REST API 2.1+) Create a pod

Creates a pod on the local array. Each pod must be given a unique name across the arrays to which they are stretched. A pod cannot be stretched to an array that already contains a pod with the same name. After a pod has been created, add volumes and protection groups, and then stretch the pod to another connected array. Known issue: cmdlet claims to create pod with tags, however tag related parameters are silently ignored. As a workaround, use cmdlet Set-Pfa2PodTagBatch to create or update tags for Pod object.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Pod [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-FailoverPreferencesId <List<String>>] [-FailoverPreferencesName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowThrottle none If set to `$True`, allows operation to fail if array health is not optimal. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-FailoverPreferencesId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-FailoverPreferencesName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-QuotaLimit none The logical quota limit of the pod, measured in bytes. Must be a multiple of 512.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-SourceId SourceIds (REST API 2.3+) The source pod from where data is cloned to create the new pod. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames (REST API 2.3+) The source pod from where data is cloned to create the new pod. false False None
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PodArray

(REST API 2.1+) Creates a pod to be stretched to an array

Creates a pod to be stretched to an array. When a pod is stretched to an array, the data in the arrays over which the pod is stretched is synchronously replicated. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the pod to be stretched. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array over which the pod is to be stretched. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together. (Deprecated) Use pods/members instead.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PodArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PodReplicaLink

(REST API 2.2+) Create pod replica links

Creates pod replica links between two arrays. The `LocalPodName` and `RemotePodName` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-RemoteId <List<String>>] [-RemoteName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-LocalPodId LocalPodIds A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodName` query parameter. false False None
-LocalPodName LocalPodNames A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodId` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteId RemoteIds A list of remote array IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteName` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteName RemoteNames A list of remote array names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteId` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodId RemotePodIds A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodName` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodName RemotePodNames A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodId` query parameter. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PodTest

Create an attempt to clone a pod

Creates an attempt to clone a pod on the local array without actually cloning it to test whether the pod can be successfully cloned. This action does not suppport pod creation.

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-FailoverPreferencesId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-FailoverPreferencesName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None

minimum: 1048576


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-SourceId SourceIds The source pod from where data is cloned to create the new pod. false False None

New-Pfa2PolicyAlertWatcher

Create alert-watcher policies

Creates one or more alert-watcher policies. To copy a policy, the `SourceName` or `SourceId` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. To create a policy from scratch, policy body is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyAlertWatcher [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyAlertWatcherRule

Create alert-watcher policy rules

Creates one or more alert-watcher policy rules. Either the 'policy_ids' or 'policy_names' parameter is required, but both parameters cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyAlertWatcherRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RuleEmail <List<String>>] [-RuleExcludedCode <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]]>] [-RuleIncludedCode <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]]>] [-RuleMinimumNotificationSeverity <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RuleEmail RulesEmail The email address that will receive the alert notification emails.


reference: PolicyrulealertwatcherpostRules		 false False None
-RuleExcludedCode RulesExcludedCodes An alert with one of these codes will not have emails sent to the recipient. Cannot be specified with `include_codes`. If specified while `include_codes` is already set, `include_codes` will be cleared. Use "" to clear. If both `exclude_codes` and `include_codes` are cleared, defaults to an empty list for `exclude_codes`.


reference: PolicyrulealertwatcherpostRules		 false False None
-RuleIncludedCode RulesIncludedCodes An alert must have one of these codes in order for emails to be sent to the recipient. Cannot be specified with `exclude_codes`. If specified while `exclude_codes` is already set, `exclude_codes` will be cleared. Use "" to clear. If both `exclude_codes` and `include_codes` are cleared, defaults to an empty list for `exclude_codes`.


reference: PolicyrulealertwatcherpostRules		 false False None
-RuleMinimumNotificationSeverity RulesMinimumNotificationSeverity The minimum severity that an alert must have in order for emails to be sent to the recipient. Possible values include `info`, `warning`, and `critical`. If not specified, defaults to `info`.


reference: PolicyrulealertwatcherpostRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyAutodir

Create auto managed directory policies

Creates one or more auto managed directory policies. To copy a policy, set one of either `SourceName` or `SourceId`. Each policy can only have one entry. To create a policy from scratch, policy body is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyAutodir [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyAutodirMember

Create auto managed directory policies

Creates a membership between one or more resources with an auto managed directory policy. Applicable resources are directories. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyAutodirMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None

New-Pfa2PolicyNfs

(REST API 2.3+) Create NFS policies

Creates one or more NFS policies or copies an existing policy. To copy a policy, the `SourceName` or `SourceId` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. To create a policy, policy body is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyNfs [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyMappingMapping <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-UserMappingEnabled <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyMappingMapping none If set specifies the initial mapping of the policy upon its creation across a pod replica link. Policy being created must be in a source pod of a replica-link. If set specifies the initial mapping of the policy upon its creation across a pod replica link. Policy being created must be in a source pod of a replica-link. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-UserMappingEnabled none (REST API 2.15+) If set to `$True`, FlashArray queries the joined AD/OpenLDAP server to find the user corresponding to the incoming UID. If set to `$False`, users are defined by UID/GID pair. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyNfsClientRule

(REST API 2.3+) Create NFS client policy rules

Creates one or more NFS client policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyNfsClientRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RulesAccess <List<String>>] [-RulesAnongid <List<String>>] [-RulesAnonuid <List<String>>] [-RulesClient <List<String>>] [-RulesNfsVersion <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-RulesPermission <List<String>>] [-RulesSecurity <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RulesAccess none Specifies access control for the export. Valid values include `root-squash`, `all-squash`, and `no-root-squash`. The value `root-squash` prevents client users and groups with root privilege from mapping their root privilege to a file system. All users with UID 0 will have their UID mapped to `RulesAnonuid`. All users with GID 0 will have their GID mapped to `RulesAnongid`. The value `all-squash` maps all UIDs (including root) to `RulesAnonuid` and all GIDs (including root) to `RulesAnongid`. The value `no-root-squash` allows users and groups to access the file system with their UIDs and GIDs. If not specified, the default value is `root-squash`.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesAnongid none Any user whose GID is affected by an `RulesAccess` of `root_squash` or `all_squash` will have their GID mapped to `RulesAnongid`. The default `RulesAnongid` is null, which means 65534. Use "" to clear. This value is ignored when user mapping is enabled.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesAnonuid none Any user whose UID is affected by an `RulesAccess` of `root_squash` or `all_squash` will have their UID mapped to `RulesAnonuid`. The default `RulesAnonuid` is null, which means 65534. Use "" to clear.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesClient none Specifies which clients are given access. Valid values include `IP`, `IP mask`, or `hostname`. The default is `*` if not specified.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesNfsVersion none NFS protocol version allowed for the export. Valid values are `nfsv3` and `nfsv4`. If not specified, defaults to `nfsv3`.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesPermission none Specifies which read-write client access permissions are allowed for the export. Values include `rw` and `ro`. The default value is `rw` if not specified.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesSecurity none The security flavors to use for accessing files on this mount point. Values include `auth_sys`, `krb5`, `krb5i`, and `krb5p`. If the server does not support the requested flavor, the mount operation fails. This operation updates all rules of the specified policy. If `auth_sys`, the client is trusted to specify the identity of the user. If `krb5`, cryptographic proof of the identity of the user is provided in each RPC request. This provides strong verification of the identity of users accessing data on the server. Note that additional configuration besides adding this mount option is required to enable Kerberos security. If `krb5i`, integrity checking is added to krb5. This ensures the data has not been tampered with. If `krb5p`, integrity checking and encryption is added to krb5. This is the most secure setting, but it also involves the most performance overhead.


reference: PolicyrulenfsclientpostRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyNfsMember

(REST API 2.3+) Create NFS policies

Creates a membership between one or more resources and an NFS policy. Applicable resources are directories. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyNfsMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-MemberExportName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-MemberServerId <List<String>>] [-MemberServerName <List<String>>] [-MembersExportEnabled <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-MemberExportName MembersExportName The name of the export to create when applying the export policy to the directory. Export names must be unique within the same protocol.


reference: PolicymemberexportpostMembers		 false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberServerId MembersServerId A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-MemberServerName MembersServerName The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-MembersExportEnabled none If set to `$True`, the export is enabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: PolicymemberexportpostMembers		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `policy01,pod01::policy01`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2PolicyQuotaMember

(REST API 2.7+) Create a membership between a managed directory and a quota policy

Creates a membership between one or more managed directories and a quota policy. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyQuotaMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule

(REST API 2.7+) Create quota policy rules

Creates one or more quota policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RuleEnforced <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-RuleNotification <List<String>>] [-RuleQuotaLimit <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RuleEnforced RulesEnforced If set to `$True`, this rule describes an enforced quota. An out-of-space warning is issued if logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule. If set to `$False`, this rule describes an unenforced quota. Alerts and/or notifications are issued when logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.


reference: PolicyrulequotapostRules		 false False None
-RuleNotification RulesNotifications Targets to notify when usage approaches the quota limit. The list of notification targets is a comma-separated string. Valid values are one or more of `user` and `group`. To notify no targets, use `none`. If not specified, defaults to `none`.


reference: PolicyrulequotapostRules		 false False None
-RuleQuotaLimit RulesQuotaLimit Logical space limit of the quota (in bytes) assigned by the rule. This value cannot be set to 0.


reference: PolicyrulequotapostRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicySmb

(REST API 2.3+) Create SMB policies

Creates one or more SMB policies. To copy a policy, set one of either `SourceName` or `SourceId`. Each policy can only have one entry. To create a policy from scratch, policy body is required. To create an SMB policy with access based enumeration enabled, set `AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled=$True`. To create an SMB policy with continuous availability enabled, set `continuous_availability=$True`.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicySmb [-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-ContinuousAvailabilityEnabled <Boolean>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyMappingMapping <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, enables access based enumeration on the policy. When access based enumeration is enabled on a policy, files and folders within exports that are attached to the policy will be hidden from users who do not have permission to view them. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-ContinuousAvailabilityEnabled none Returns a value of `$True` if continuous availability is enabled on the policy. When continuous availability is enabled on a policy, file shares are accessible during otherwise disruptive scenarios such as temporary network outages, controller upgrades or failovers. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyMappingMapping none If set specifies the initial mapping of the policy upon its creation across a pod replica link. Policy being created must be in a source pod of a replica-link. If set specifies the initial mapping of the policy upon its creation across a pod replica link. Policy being created must be in a source pod of a replica-link. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicySmbClientRule

(REST API 2.3+) Create SMB client policy rules

Creates one or more SMB client policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicySmbClientRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RulesAnonymousAccessAllowed <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-RulesClient <List<String>>] [-RulesSmbEncryptionRequired <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RulesAnonymousAccessAllowed none Specifies whether access to information is allowed for anonymous users. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.


reference: PolicyrulesmbclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesClient none Specifies which clients are given access. Accepted notation, IP, IP mask, or hostname. The default is `*` if not specified.


reference: PolicyrulesmbclientpostRules		 false False None
-RulesSmbEncryptionRequired none Specifies whether the remote client is required to use SMB encryption. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.


reference: PolicyrulesmbclientpostRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None
