-MemberServerId MembersServerId A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-MemberServerName MembersServerName The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-MembersExportEnabled none If set to `$True`, the export is enabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: PolicymemberexportpostMembers		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `policy01,pod01::policy01`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2PolicySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) Create snapshot policies

Creates one or more snapshot policies. To copy a policy, set one of either `SourceName` or `SourceId`. Each policy can only have one entry. To create a policy from scratch, policy body is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

New-Pfa2PolicySnapshotMember

(REST API 2.3+) Create snapshot policies

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None

New-Pfa2PolicySnapshotRule

(REST API 2.3+) Create snapshot policy rules

Creates one or more snapshot policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicySnapshotRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RuleAt <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-RuleClientName <List<String>>] [-RuleEvery <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-RuleKeepFor <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-RuleSuffix <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RuleAt RulesAt Specifies the number of milliseconds since midnight at which to take a snapshot. The `RuleAt` value can only be set to an hour and must be between 0 and 82800000, inclusive. The `RuleAt` value can only be set on the rule with the smallest `RuleEvery` value. The `RuleAt` value cannot be set if the `RuleEvery` value is not measured in days. The `RuleAt` value can only be set for at most one rule in the same policy.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 false False None
-RuleClientName RulesClientName The snapshot client name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the snapshot client name, and `SUFFIX` is the snapshot suffix. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 false False None
-RuleEvery RulesEvery Specifies the interval between snapshots, in milliseconds. The `RuleEvery` value for all rules must be multiples of one another. The `RuleEvery` value must be unique for each rule in the same policy. The `RuleEvery` value must be between 5 minutes and 1 year.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 false False None
-RuleKeepFor RulesKeepFor Specifies the period that snapshots are retained before they are eradicated, in milliseconds. The `RuleKeepFor` value cannot be less than the `RuleEvery` value of the rule. The `RuleKeepFor` value must be unique for each rule in the same policy. The `RuleKeepFor` value must be between 5 minutes and 5 years. The `RuleKeepFor` value cannot be less than the `RuleKeepFor` value of any rule in the same policy with a smaller `RuleEvery` value.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 false False None
-RuleSuffix RulesSuffix The snapshot suffix name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the snapshot client name, and `SUFFIX` is the snapshot suffix. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. The `RuleSuffix` value can only be set for one rule in the same policy. The `RuleSuffix` value can only be set on a rule with the same `RuleKeepFor` value and `RuleEvery` value. The `RuleSuffix` value can only be set on the rule with the largest `RuleKeepFor` value. If not specified, defaults to a monotonically increasing number generated by the system.


reference: PolicyrulesnapshotpostRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

New-Pfa2PolicyUserGroupQuotaMember

Create a membership between a managed directory and a user-group-quota policy

Creates a membership between one or more managed directories and a user-group-quota policy. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyUserGroupQuotaMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for user-group-quota management operations. If set to `$True`, user/group usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` of user-group-quota rules. If set to `$False`, the impact of the user-group-quota operation is checked against the user/group usage in the managed directory and its ancestors and the operation is not allowed if the user/group usage would exceed any enforced user-group-quota limits. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberName MemberNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-MemberResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2PolicyUserGroupQuotaRule

Create user-group-quota policy rules

Creates one or more user-group-quota policy rules. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PolicyUserGroupQuotaRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RuleEnforced <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-RuleNotification <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-RuleQuotaLimit <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-RulesQuotaType <List<String>>] [-RulesSubjectId <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-RulesSubjectName <List<String>>] [-RulesSubjectSid <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for user-group-quota management operations. If set to `$True`, user/group usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` of user-group-quota rules. If set to `$False`, the impact of the user-group-quota operation is checked against the user/group usage in the managed directory and its ancestors and the operation is not allowed if the user/group usage would exceed any enforced user-group-quota limits. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RuleEnforced RulesEnforced If set to `$True`, the quota is enforced and an out-of-space warning is issued if logical space usage exceeds the specified limit. If set to `$False`, the quota is not enforced and alerts and/or notifications are issued when logical space usage exceeds the limit value. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotapostRules		 false False None
-RuleNotification RulesNotifications Targets to notify when usage approaches or exceeds the quota limit. Valid non-empty values are `account` or `none`. The `account` value specifies that the user or group owning the usage will be notified, `none` specifies that notifications are not sent. If not specified, we assume `none`.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotapostRules		 false False None
-RuleQuotaLimit RulesQuotaLimit Logical space limit of the quota (in bytes) assigned by the rule. This value cannot be negative.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotapostRules		 false False None
-RulesQuotaType none Specifies the type of quota rule. Valid values are `user-default`, `user`, `user-group-member`, `group-default` and `group`. Every user-group-quota rule requires a mandatory rule type.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotapostRules		 false False None
-RulesSubjectId none The subject User Identifier (UID) or Group Identifier (GID). Exactly one of `RulesSubjectName`, `RulesSubjectId`, `RulesSubjectSid` is required.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotaSubjectRW		 false False None
-RulesSubjectName none The subject name. Retrieves all accounts matching this name. The name can have a `@domain` suffix to reduce ambiguity. Exactly one of `RulesSubjectName`, `RulesSubjectId`, or `RulesSubjectSid` is required.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotaSubjectRW		 false False None
-RulesSubjectSid none The subject Security Identifier (SID), which uniquely identifies a user or group. Exactly one of `RulesSubjectName`, `RulesSubjectId`, or `RulesSubjectSid` is required.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotaSubjectRW		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

New-Pfa2PresetWorkload

Create a workload preset

Creates one workload preset. Examples of the format for parameter -PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRemoteTargets: @(@{ Id = "{{ parameters.r1.id }}"; Name = "{{ parameters.r1.name }}"; ResourceType = "{{ parameters.r1.resource_type }}" }), @(@{ Id = "resource_id"; ResourceType = "remote-arrays" }), @(@{ Name = "resource_name"; ResourceType = "remote-arrays" })

Syntax 

New-Pfa2PresetWorkload [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Description <String>] -Name <String> [-ParametersConstraintsBooleanDefault <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerDefault <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMaximum <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMinimum <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceAllowedValuesResourceType <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultId <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultName <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultResourceType <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsStringAllowedValues <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-ParametersConstraintsStringDefault <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataDescription <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataDisplayName <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataSubtype <List<String>>] [-ParametersName <List<String>>] [-ParametersType <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRemoteTargets <Hashtable[]>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsQosConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassId <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassName <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassResourceType <List<String>>] [-QosConfigurationsBandwidthLimit <List<String>>] [-QosConfigurationsIopsLimit <List<String>>] [-QosConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesAt <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesEvery <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesKeepFor <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsCount <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsPeriodicReplicationConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-VolumeConfigurationsPlacementConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-VolumeConfigurationsProvisionedSize <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsSnapshotConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-WorkloadTagsCopyable <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsKey <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsValue <List<String>>] [-WorkloadType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Description none A brief description of the workload the preset will configure. Supports up to 1KB of unicode characters. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique resource names specified. Only one value is supported. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ParametersConstraintsBooleanDefault none The default value to use if no value is provided.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsBoolean		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues none The valid values that can be supplied to the parameter. A parameter that collects the number of volumes to provision might, for example, limit the allowed values to a few fixed options. Supports up to five values.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsInteger		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsIntegerDefault none The default value to use if no value is provided. Must be present in `ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues`, if set. Must comply with `ParametersConstraintsIntegerMinimum`, if set. Must comply with `ParametersConstraintsIntegerMaximum`, if set.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsInteger		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMaximum none The maximum acceptable value, inclusive.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsInteger		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMinimum none The minimum acceptable value, inclusive.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsInteger		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceAllowedValuesResourceType none ">The type of resource the parameter references. Valid values include `storage-classes` and `remote-arrays`. false False None
-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsStringAllowedValues none The valid values that can be supplied to the parameter. A parameter that collects the name of the environment to which a workload will deploy might, for example, limit the allowed values to `production`, `testing` and `development`. Supports up to five values, with up to 64 unicode characters per value.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsString		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsStringDefault none The default value to use if no value is provided. Must be present in `ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues`, if `ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues` is set. Supports up to 64 unicode characters.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsString		 false False None
-ParametersMetadataDescription none A brief description of the parameter and how it is used within the preset. Supports up to 1KB of unicode characters.


reference: PresetWorkloadMetadata		 false False None
-ParametersMetadataDisplayName none The human-friendly name of the parameter, which will be shown in the GUI instead of the standard name if configured. Supports up to 64 unicode characters.


reference: PresetWorkloadMetadata		 false False None
-ParametersMetadataSubtype none The subtype of the parameter, which the GUI will use to contextualize the prompt for the parameter value. For example, when set to size, the GUI will display an input field with a dropdown menu that contains common size units such as MB, GB, TB, etc. Valid values include `size`, `iops`, `bandwidth`, `time` and `duration`. Subtype can only be used with integer parameters.


reference: PresetWorkloadMetadata		 false False None
-ParametersName none The name of the parameter, by which other fields in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all parameters in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadParameter		 false False None
-ParametersType none The type of the parameter. Valid values include `string`, `integer`, `boolean` and `resource_reference`. String parameters can be used to collect metadata about workloads deployed from the preset, such as the environment to which they are deployed (e.g., production, development, etc.) or the billing account to which they belong for charge back and show back purposes. Integer and boolean parameters can be used to configure specific fields in the preset, such as the number or size of volumes to provision. Resource reference parameters can be used to collect references to other objects, such as storage classes or remote arrays.


reference: PresetWorkloadParameter		 false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsName none The name of the periodic replication configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadPeriodicReplicationConfiguration		 false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRemoteTargets none The remote targets to which snapshots may be replicated. Provide 1 value(s).


reference: PresetWorkloadPeriodicReplicationConfiguration		 false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt none ">Specifies the number of milliseconds since midnight at which to take a snapshot. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value cannot be set if the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value is not measured in days. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value can only be set on the first rule. false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery none ">Specifies the interval between snapshots, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value for all rules must be multiples of one another. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and 400 days for the first rule. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and one day for the second rule. false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor none ">Specifies the period that snapshots are retained before they are eradicated, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 24855 days for the first rule, and a multiple of a second. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 2147483647 days for the second rule, and must be greater than or equal to the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value of the first rule. false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsName none The name of the placement configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadPlacementConfiguration		 false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsQosConfigurations none The names of the QoS configurations to apply to the storage resources (such as volumes) in the placement. The limits defined in the QoS configurations will be shared across all storage resources in the placement. Provide at most 1 value(s).


reference: PresetWorkloadPlacementConfiguration		 false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-QosConfigurationsBandwidthLimit none The QoS IOPs limit shared across all volumes in the placement. Between 100 and 100000000, inclusive. Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration		 false False None
-QosConfigurationsIopsLimit none The maximum QoS bandwidth limit shared across all volumes in the placement. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Between 1MB/s and 512 GB/s, inclusive. Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration		 false False None
-QosConfigurationsName none The name of the QoS configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration		 false False None
-SnapshotConfigurationsName none The name of the snapshot configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadSnapshotConfiguration		 false False None
-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesAt none ">Specifies the number of milliseconds since midnight at which to take a snapshot. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value cannot be set if the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value is not measured in days. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value can only be set on the first rule. false False None
-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesEvery none ">Specifies the interval between snapshots, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value for all rules must be multiples of one another. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and 400 days for the first rule. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and one day for the second rule. false False None
-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesKeepFor none ">Specifies the period that snapshots are retained before they are eradicated, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 24855 days for the first rule, and a multiple of a second. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 2147483647 days for the second rule, and must be greater than or equal to the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value of the first rule. false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsCount none The number of volumes to provision. Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsName none The name of the volume configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsPeriodicReplicationConfigurations none The names of the periodic replication configurations to apply to the volumes.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsPlacementConfigurations none The names of the placement configurations with which to associate the volumes. Provide 1 value(s).


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsProvisionedSize none The virtual size of each volume. Measured in bytes and must be a multiple of 512. The maximum size is 4503599627370496 (4PB). Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsSnapshotConfigurations none The names of the snapshot configurations to apply to the volumes.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-WorkloadTagsCopyable none Specifies whether to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: PresetWorkloadWorkloadTag		 false False None
-WorkloadTagsKey none Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: PresetWorkloadWorkloadTag		 false False None
-WorkloadTagsNamespace none Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `ParametersConstraintsBooleanDefault`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: PresetWorkloadWorkloadTag		 false False None
-WorkloadTagsValue none Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters. Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadWorkloadTag		 false False None
-WorkloadType none The type of workload the preset will configure. Valid values include `VDI`, `File`, `MySQL` etc. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a protection group and upsert tags

Creates a protection group on the local array for asynchronous replication. For more information of creating volumes under SafeMode, run `Get-Help About_Pfa2Safemode`

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • New-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing object during an object copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing object, the copy operation fails. Required if the `source` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing object during the copy operation. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds The id of the protection group or protection group snapshot to be copied into a new or existing protection group. If the destination protection group and all of its volumes already exist, include the `Overwrite` parameter to overwrite all of the existing volumes with the snapshot contents. If including the `Overwrite` parameter, the names of the volumes that are being overwritten must match the names of the volumes that are being restored. If the source is a protection group, the latest snapshot of the protection group will be used as the source during the copy operation. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The name of the protection group or protection group snapshot to be copied into a new or existing protection group. If the destination protection group and all of its volumes already exist, include the `Overwrite` parameter to overwrite all of the existing volumes with the snapshot contents. If including the `Overwrite` parameter, the names of the volumes that are being overwritten must match the names of the volumes that are being restored. If the source is a protection group, the latest snapshot of the protection group will be used as the source during the copy operation. false False None
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost

(REST API 2.1+) Create an action to add a host to a protection group

Creates an action to add a host member to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHostGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Creates an action to add a host group to a protection group

Creates an action to add a host group member to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Create a protection group snapshot and create tags.

Creates a point-in-time snapshot of the contents of a protection group. The `SourceId` or `SourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowThrottle none If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-ApplyRetention none If `$True`, applies the local and remote retention policy to the snapshots. false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none (REST API 2.3+) Returns a value of `$True` if the protection group snapshot has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed snapshot is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed snapshot can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the snapshot is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-ForReplication none (REST API 2.4+) If `$True`, destroys and eradicates the snapshot after 1 hour. false False None
-Replicate none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, queues up and begins replicating to each allowed target after all earlier replication sessions for the same protection group have been completed to that target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-ReplicateNow none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Suffix none The name suffix appended to the protection group name to make up the full protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If `Suffix` is not specified, the protection group name is in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `NNN` is a unique monotonically increasing number. If multiple protection group snapshots are created at a time, the suffix name is appended to those snapshots. false False None
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotReplica

Create an action to send protection group snapshots

Creates an action to send protection group snapshots to protection pgroup targets. When the `On` option is used, only specified targets will recieve the protection group snapshots.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotReplica [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-ConvertSourceToBaseline <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-ConvertSourceToBaseline none Set to `$True` to have the snapshot be eradicated when it is no longer baseline on source. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation locally with the target names specified as the destinations of the operation. Enter multiple target names. For example, `targetName01,targetName02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotTest

Create an attempt to take protection group snapshot

Creates an attempt to take the protection group snapshot, without actually taking it, to test if the snapshot can be successfully taken.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotTest [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

-AllowThrottle none If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal. false False None

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `$True` if the protection group snapshot has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed snapshot is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed snapshot can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the snapshot is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-ForReplication none If `$True`, destroys and eradicates the snapshot after 1 hour. false False None
-Replicate none If set to `$True`, queues up and begins replicating to each allowed target after all earlier replication sessions for the same protection group have been completed to that target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-ReplicateNow none If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None

If multiple protection group snapshots are created at a time, the suffix name is appended to those snapshots. false False None
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: Tag		 false False None

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget

(REST API 2.1+) Create an action to add a target to a protection group

Creates an action to add an array, pod, or offload target to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array, pod, or offload target that is being added to the protection group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None

-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume

(REST API 2.1+) Create a volume to add it to a protection group

Creates a volume member and adds it to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` parameter, and either the `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Realm

Create realms

Creates realms on the local array. Each realm must be given a name that is unique across the connected arrays.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Realm [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] -Name <String> [-QosBandwidthFloor <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsFloor <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-QosBandwidthFloor none Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosIopsFloor none Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimit none Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QuotaLimit none The logical quota limit of the realm, measured in bytes. Must be a multiple of 512.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.4+) Create remote protection group snapshot

Creates remote protection group snapshots.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-ConvertSourceToBaseline <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowThrottle none If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-ApplyRetention none If `$True`, applies the local and remote retention policy to the snapshots. false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-ConvertSourceToBaseline none Set to `$True` to have the snapshot be eradicated when it is no longer baseline on source. false False None
-Destroyed none Destroyed and pending eradication? If not specified, defaults to $False. false False None
-ForReplication none If `$True`, destroys and eradicates the snapshot after 1 hour. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-Replicate none If set to `$True`, queues up and begins replicating to each allowed target after all earlier replication sessions for the same protection group have been completed to that target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-ReplicateNow none If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Suffix none The suffix that is appended to the `source_name` value to generate the full remote protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If the suffix is not specified, the system constructs the snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `PGROUP` is the protection group name, and `NNN` is a monotonically increasing number. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2SnmpManager

(REST API 2.4+) Create SNMP manager

Creates a Purity SNMP manager object that identifies a host (SNMP manager) and specifies the protocol attributes for communicating with it. Once a manager object is created, the transmission of SNMP traps is immediately enabled.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2SnmpManager [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Host <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Notification <String>] [-V2cCommunity <String>] [-V3AuthPassphrase <String>] [-V3AuthProtocol <String>] [-V3PrivacyPassphrase <String>] [-V3PrivacyProtocol <String>] [-V3User <String>] [-Version <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Host none DNS hostname or IP address of a computer that hosts an SNMP manager to which Purity//FA is to send trap messages when it generates alerts. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Notification none The type of notification the agent will send. Valid values are `inform` and `trap`. false False None
-V2cCommunity none The v2c configurations of SNMP. The v2c configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3AuthPassphrase none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3AuthProtocol none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3PrivacyPassphrase none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3PrivacyProtocol none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-V3User none The v3 configurations of SNMP. The v3 configurations of SNMP. false False None
-Version Versions Version of the SNMP protocol to be used by Purity//FA to communicate with the specified manager. Valid values are `v2c` and `v3`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.String

New-Pfa2SoftwareCheck

(REST API 2.9+) Create a software check task

Creates a software check task. If there are no previously queued or running software check tasks, the new task immediately starts. Otherwise, it is queued and starts once all previously queued or running software check tasks finish. To create a task, use a software name and version.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2SoftwareCheck [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-SoftwareName <List<String>>] [-SoftwareVersion <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-SoftwareName SoftwareNames A list of software names. false False None
-SoftwareVersion SoftwareVersions A list of target software versions. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation

(REST API 2.3+) Create a software upgrade

Creates and initiates a software upgrade.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Mode <String>] [-OverrideCheckArgs <List<String>>] [-OverrideCheckName <List<String>>] [-OverrideCheckPersistent <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] -SoftwareId <List<String>> [-UpgradeParameterName <List<String>>] [-UpgradeParameterValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Mode none Mode that the upgrade is in. Valid values are `check-only`, `interactive`, `semi-interactive`, and `one-click`. The `check_only` mode is deprecated. Use `/software-checks`. In this mode, the upgrade only runs pre-upgrade checks and returns. In `interactive` mode, the upgrade pauses at several points, at which users must enter certain commands to proceed. In `semi-interactive` mode, the upgrade pauses if there are any upgrade check failures and functions like `one-click` mode otherwise. In `one-click` mode, the upgrade proceeds automatically without pausing. false False None
-OverrideCheckArgs OverrideChecksArgs The name of the specific check within the override check to ignore so that the system can continue with the software upgrade. The `OverrideCheckName` parameter of the override check must be specified with the `OverrideCheckArgs` parameter. For example, if the HostIOCheck check fails on hosts host01 and host02, the system displays a list of these host names in the failed check. To override the HostIOCheck checks for host01 and host02, set `OverrideCheckName=HostIOCheck`, and set `OverrideCheckArgs=host01,host02`. Enter multiple `OverrideCheckArgs`. Note that not all checks have `OverrideCheckArgs` values.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-OverrideCheckName OverrideChecksNames The name of the upgrade check to be overridden so the software upgrade can continue if the check failed or is anticipated to fail during the upgrade process. Overriding the check forces the system to ignore the check failure and continue with the upgrade. If the check includes more specific checks that failed or are anticipated to fail, set them using the `OverrideCheckArgs` parameter. For example, the HostIOCheck check may include a list of hosts that have failed or are anticipated to fail the upgrade check.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-OverrideCheckPersistent OverrideChecksPersistent If set to `$True`, the system always ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check and continues with the upgrade process. If set to `$False`, the system ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check until the upgrade check finishes and the upgrade process is continued. For example, the `continue` command is successfully issued in an `interactive` mode, or the first upgrade check step successfully finishes in a `one-click` mode.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-SoftwareId SoftwareIds A list of software IDs. true False None
-UpgradeParameterName UpgradeParametersName The name of the upgrade parameter to be sent to the upgrade process.


reference: UpgradeParameters		 false False None
-UpgradeParameterValue UpgradeParametersValue The value of the upgrade parameter to be sent to the upgrade process.


reference: UpgradeParameters		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Subnet

(REST API 2.2+) Create subnet

Creates a subnet with the specified parameters.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Subnet [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Gateway <String>] [-Mtu <Int32>] -Name <String> [-Prefix <String>] [-Vlan <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none Returns a value of `$True` if subnet is enabled. Returns a value of `$False` if subnet is disabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-Gateway none The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the gateway through which the specified subnet is to communicate with the network. false False None
-Mtu none Maximum message transfer unit (packet) size for the subnet in bytes. MTU setting cannot exceed the MTU of the corresponding physical interface. If not specified, defaults to `1500`.


minimum: 1280


maximum: 9216		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Prefix none The IPv4 or IPv6 address to be associated with the specified subnet. false False None
-Vlan none VLAN ID number. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.String
