New-Pfa2SyslogServer

(REST API 2.4+) Create syslog server

Creates a new syslog server.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2SyslogServer [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Service <List<String>>] [-Uri <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Service Services Valid values are `data-audit` and `management`. If not specified, defaults to `management`. false False None
-Uri Uris The URI of the syslog server in the format `PROTOCOL://HOSTNAME:PORT`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Vchost

Create a vchost

Creates a vchost. The `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Vchost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-Vcuuid <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Vcuuid none The vCenter Server uuid of the vchost. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2VchostCertificate

Create a vchost certificate

Creates an association between a certificate and vchost on one or more endpoints. The `VchostName` or `VchostId` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VchostCertificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CertificateName <String>] [-CertificateResourceType <String>] [-Endpoint <List<String>>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CertificateName CertificateNames The certificate to be presented by the vchost over the configured endpoints. false False None
-CertificateResourceType none The certificate to be presented by the vchost over the configured endpoints. The certificate to be presented by the vchost over the configured endpoints. false False None
-Endpoint Endpoints The IPv4 or IPv6 addresses of the endpoints to configure for the vchost, over which the configured certificate will be presented. false False None
-VchostId VchostIds Performs the operation on the unique vchost IDs specified. Enter multiple vchost IDs in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. false False None
-VchostName VchostNames Performs the operation on the unique vchost name specified. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2VchostConnection

Create a vchost-connection between protocol endpoint and vchost.

Creates a vchost-connection between protocol endpoint and vchost. Each vchost is associated with a vCenter. Each protocol endpoint is associated with a storage container. A vchost-connection makes the storage container accessible to the vCenter when the vCenter attempts to mount the container. One of `ProtocolEndpointName` or `ProtocolEndpointId` query parameters and one of `VchostName` or `VchostId` query parameters are required. But if `AllVchosts` is set to `$True`, `VchostName` and `VchostId` should not be specified.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VchostConnection [-AllVchosts <Boolean>] [-AllowStretchedMultiVchost <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllVchosts none If set to `$True`, the storage container represented by the protocol endpoint is accessible to all vchosts. Users should not specify `VchostId` or `VchostName` in the request. If set to `$False`, the storage container represented by the protocol endpoint is only accessible to the vchosts that have explicit vchost-connections with the protocol endpoint. Users need to specify `VchostId` or `VchostName` in the request. false False None
-AllowStretchedMultiVchost none If set to `$True`, users are allowed to create a new vchost-connection to a stretched container that already has a vchost-connection. In principle, a stretched container can only have one vchost-connection at a time. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointId ProtocolEndpointIds A list of protocol endpoint IDs. Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. For example, `peid01,peid02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `ProtocolEndpointName`. If the list contains more than one value, then `VchostId` or `VchostName` must have exactly one value. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointName ProtocolEndpointNames A list of protocol endpoint names. Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. For example, `pe01,pe02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `ProtocolEndpointId`. If the list contains more than one value, then `VchostId` or `VchostName` must have exactly one value. false False None
-VchostId VchostIds A list of vchost IDs. Performs the operation on the vchosts specified. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `VchostName`. If the list contains more than one value, then `ProtocolEndpointId` or `ProtocolEndpointName` must have exactly one value. false False None
-VchostName VchostNames A list of vchost names. Performs the operation on the vchosts specified. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `VchostId`. If the list contains more than one value, then `ProtocolEndpointId` or `ProtocolEndpointName` must have exactly one value. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2VchostEndpoint

Create a vchost endpoint

Creates a vchost endpoint. Either the `VchostName` or `VchostId` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VchostEndpoint [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CertificatesName <List<String>>] [-CertificatesResourceType <List<String>>] [-Endpoint <String>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CertificatesName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceNoIdWithType		 false False None
-CertificatesResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values include `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceNoIdWithType		 false False None
-Endpoint Endpoints The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the endpoint. false False None
-VchostId VchostIds Performs the operation on the unique vchost IDs specified. Enter multiple vchost IDs in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. false False None
-VchostName VchostNames Performs the operation on the unique vchost name specified. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2VirtualMachine

(REST API 2.10+) Create a virtual machine

Creates one or more virtual machines from a protection group snapshot. If the virtual machine is of type `vvol`, the `source` property of the request body must be a `recovery_context` value retrieved from the `Get-Pfa2VirtualMachine /virtual-machine-snapshots` endpoint. If `Overwrite` is specified, an existing virtual machine will have its volumes overwritten by the snapshot. Otherwise, a new virtual machine will be created from the snapshot. If creating the new virtual machine will cause a conflict with an existing virtual machine, the operation will fail.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VirtualMachine [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-VmId <String>] [-VmType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Id Ids The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. `Id` is deprecated. Use `VmId` instead. false False None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing object during an object copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing object, the copy operation fails. Required if the `source` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing object during the copy operation. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified. false False None
-VmId VmIds (REST API 2.14+) The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. false False None
-VmType none The type of virtual machine. The only valid value is `vvol`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2Volume

(REST API 2.0+) Create or copy a volume and upsert tags

Creates one or more virtual storage volumes of the specified size. If `Provisioned` is not specified, the size of the new volume defaults to 1MB. (`Provisioned` sets the virtual size of the volume, measured in bytes. Volume size must be a multiple of 512 bytes between 1 MB and 4PB. Byte multipliers KB, MB, GB, TB and PB are supported, with no space between number and multiplier, such as `1PB`. Maximum value 4503599627370496.) The `Name` query parameter is required. The `AddToProtectionGroupNames` query parameter specifies a list of protection group names that will compose the initial protection for the volume. The `WithDefaultProtection` query parameter specifies whether to use the container default protection configuration for the volume. The `AddToProtectionGroupNames` and `WithDefaultProtection` query parameters cannot be provided when `Overwrite` is `$True`. For more information of creating volumes under SafeMode, run `Get-Help About_Pfa2Safemode`

Syntax 

New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-WorkloadConfiguration <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-WorkloadConfiguration <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-WorkloadConfiguration <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-WorkloadConfiguration <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddToProtectionGroupIds none The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple ids. false False None
-AddToProtectionGroupNames none The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-AllowThrottle none If set to `$True`, allows operation to fail if array health is not optimal. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Overwrite none If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing object during an object copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing object, the copy operation fails. Required if the `source` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing object during the copy operation. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentOperator PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator (REST API 2.10+) Valid values are `+`, `-`, and `=`. The values `+` and `-` may be applied to volumes and volume groups to reflect the relative importance of their workloads. Volumes and volume groups can be assigned a priority adjustment of -10, 0, or +10. In addition, volumes can be assigned values of =-10, =0, or =+10. Volumes with settings of -10, 0, +10 can be modified by the priority adjustment setting of a volume group that contains the volume. However, if a volume has a priority adjustment set with the `=` operator (for example, =+10), it retains that value and is unaffected by any volume group priority adjustment settings. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentValue PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue (REST API 2.10+) Adjust priority by the specified amount, using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator`. Valid values are 0 and +10 for `+` and `-` operators, -10, 0, and +10 for the `=` operator. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion none Defines vCenter and EXSi host compatibility of the protocol endpoint and its associated container. Valid values include: `1`, `2`, `3`. When `ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion` is set to `1`, it's compatible with vSphere version 7.0.1 or higher. When `ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion` is set to `2`, it's compatible with vSphere version 8.0.0 or higher. When `ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion` is set to `3`, it's compatible with vSphere version 8.0.1 or higher. The default `ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion` is `1`. false False None
-Provisioned none Sets the virtual size of the volume, measured in bytes.


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The maximum QoS bandwidth limit for the volume. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Maximum limit is 512 GB/s.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume. false False False
-QosIopsLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The QoS IOPs limit for the volume.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume. false False False
-SourceId SourceIds (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on. false False None
-Subtype none The type of volume. Valid values are `protocol_endpoint` and `regular`. false False None
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-WithDefaultProtection none If specified as `$True`, the initial protection of the newly created volumes will be the union of the container default protection configuration and `AddToProtectionGroupNames`. If specified as `$False`, the default protection of the container will not be applied automatically. The initial protection of the newly created volumes will be configured by `AddToProtectionGroupNames`. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-WorkloadConfiguration none The workload to which the volume is added. Set one of `SourceId` or `SourceName`, and `WorkloadConfiguration` to add the volume to the workload and configure it based on the `WorkloadConfiguration` from the preset the workload was originally provisioned from. The workload to which the volume is added. Set one of `SourceId` or `SourceName`, and `WorkloadConfiguration` to add the volume to the workload and configure it based on the `WorkloadConfiguration` from the preset the workload was originally provisioned from. false False None
-WorkloadId none The workload to which the volume is added. Set one of `SourceId` or `SourceName`, and `WorkloadConfiguration` to add the volume to the workload and configure it based on the `WorkloadConfiguration` from the preset the workload was originally provisioned from. false False None
-WorkloadName none The workload to which the volume is added. Set one of `SourceId` or `SourceName`, and `WorkloadConfiguration` to add the volume to the workload and configure it based on the `WorkloadConfiguration` from the preset the workload was originally provisioned from. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a volume group and upsert tags.

Creates a volume group. The volume group itself does not contain any meaningful content; instead, it acts as a container that is used to organize volumes. Once a volume group has been created, volumes can be created inside the volume group or moved into and out of the volume group.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PriorityAdjustmentOperator PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator (REST API 2.10+) Valid values are `+`, `-`, and `=`. The values `+` and `-` may be applied to volumes and volume groups to reflect the relative importance of their workloads. Volumes and volume groups can be assigned a priority adjustment of -10, 0, or +10. In addition, volumes can be assigned values of =-10, =0, or =+10. Volumes with settings of -10, 0, +10 can be modified by the priority adjustment setting of a volume group that contains the volume. However, if a volume has a priority adjustment set with the `=` operator (for example, =+10), it retains that value and is unaffected by any volume group priority adjustment settings. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentValue PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue (REST API 2.10+) Adjust priority by the specified amount, using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator`. Valid values are 0 and +10 for `+` and `-` operators, -10, 0, and +10 for the `=` operator. false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The maximum QoS bandwidth limit for the volume. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Maximum limit is 512 GB/s.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume group. false False False
-QosIopsLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The QoS IOPs limit for the volume.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume group. false False False
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.


reference: Tag		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Create a volume and add it to a protection group

Creates a volume member and adds it to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` and only one of `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

New-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.0+) Create a volume snapshot

Creates a point-in-time snapshot of the contents of a volume. The `SourceId` or `SourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-On <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllowThrottle none If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-Suffix none The suffix that is appended to the `source_name` value to generate the full volume snapshot name in the form `VOL.SUFFIX`. If the suffix is not specified, the system constructs the snapshot name in the form `VOL.NNN`, where `VOL` is the volume name, and `NNN` is a monotonically increasing number. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

reference: WorkloadParameter		 false False None

reference: WorkloadParameterValue		 false False None

reference: WorkloadParameterValue		 false False None

reference: WorkloadParameterValueResourceReference		 false False None
-ParametersValueResourceReferenceName none The name of the resource to reference. One of `ParametersValueResourceReferenceId` or `ParametersName` must be set, but they cannot be set together.


reference: WorkloadParameterValueResourceReference		 false False None
-ParametersValueResourceReferenceResourceType none The type of the resource to reference. Resource type is optional, and will be automatically determined by the server if not set.


reference: WorkloadParameterValueResourceReference		 false False None
-ParametersValueString none The value for a string parameter.


reference: WorkloadParameterValue		 false False None
-PresetIds none Create the resource using the preset specified by the ID. Only one preset can be specified. One of the `PresetIds` or `PresetNames` parameters are required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PresetNames none Create the resource using the preset specified by name. Only one preset can be specified. One of the `PresetIds` or `PresetNames` parameters are required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

New-Pfa2WorkloadPlacementRecommendation

Create a request for a workload placement recommendation.

Creates a recommendation for the placement of the specified workload. The computation might take a few minutes.

Syntax 

New-Pfa2WorkloadPlacementRecommendation [-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesId <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesName <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesResourceType <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsId <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsName <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsResourceType <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-ParametersName <List<String>>] [-ParametersValueBoolean <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-ParametersValueInteger <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersValueResourceReferenceId <List<String>>] [-ParametersValueResourceReferenceName <List<String>>] [-ParametersValueResourceReferenceResourceType <List<String>>] [-ParametersValueString <List<String>>] [-PlacementNames <List<String>>] [-PresetIds <List<String>>] [-PresetNames <List<String>>] [-ProjectionMonths <Int32>] [-RecommendationEngine <String>] [-ResultsLimit <Int32>] [-ResultsPlacementsName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesId none ">A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified. false False None
-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesName none ">The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on. false False None
-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesResourceType none ">Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc. false False None
-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-ParametersName none The name of the parameter.


reference: WorkloadParameter		 false False None
-ParametersValueBoolean none The value for a boolean parameter.


reference: WorkloadParameterValue		 false False None
-ParametersValueInteger none The value for an integer parameter.


reference: WorkloadParameterValue		 false False None
-ParametersValueResourceReferenceId none The id of the resource to reference. One of `Id` or `InputsName` must be set, but they cannot be set together.


reference: WorkloadParameterValueResourceReference		 false False None
-ParametersValueResourceReferenceName none The name of the resource to reference. One of `Id` or `InputsName` must be set, but they cannot be set together.


reference: WorkloadParameterValueResourceReference		 false False None
-ParametersValueResourceReferenceResourceType none The type of the resource to reference. Resource type is optional, and will be automatically determined by the server if not set.


reference: WorkloadParameterValueResourceReference		 false False None
-ParametersValueString none The value for a string parameter.


reference: WorkloadParameterValue		 false False None
-PlacementNames none Placements from the preset which should be used to compute recommendation. Optional parameter if preset has just one placement. false False None
-PresetIds none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified. false False None
-PresetNames none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on. false False None
-ProjectionMonths none The number of months to compute the projections. If not specified, defaults to 1 month. false False None
-RecommendationEngine none This parameter defines which engine to use for recommendations. Possible values include `pure1`, `local`, and `best-available`. If not specified, defaults to `best-available` which may mix results of different engines, while `pure1` and `local` restrict the used engine. false False None
-ResultsLimit none The maximum number of results to return. If not specified, defaults to 10 results. false False None
-ResultsPlacementsName none {{ Fill ResultsPlacementsName Description }} false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

-LocalOnly none If specified as `$True`, only delete the Active Directory configuration on the local array, without deleting the computer account created in the Active Directory domain. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2Array

(REST API 2.4+) Delete an array

Deletes an array. For physical appliances, deleting an array restores the hardware to factory settings. This entails deleting all data, metadata, configuration, and logs. The array returns to the state it was in prior to any configuration changes being made. If the hardware is reused, it must be as a different array with a new ID. For virtual appliances, deleting an array puts it into an unusable state. Virtual resources (e.g., virtual machines) can later be freed, which deletes any remaining data, metadata, configuration, and logs. Prior to factory reset, an array must be manually prepared (e.g., all volumes and snapshots must be eradicated) and a factory reset token must be created.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EradicateAllData <Boolean>] [-FactoryResetToken <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EradicateAllData none Set to `$True` to perform a factory reset. false False None
-FactoryResetToken none A token required to perform a factory reset. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2Connection

(REST API 2.0+) Delete a connection between a volume and its host or host group

Deletes the connection between a volume and its associated host or host group. One of `VolumeName` or `VolumeId` and one of `HostName` or `HostGroupName` query parameters are required.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Connection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`). false False None
-HostName HostNames Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`). false False None
-VolumeId VolumeIds Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time. false False None
-VolumeName VolumeNames Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`). false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2Directory

(REST API 2.3+) Delete managed directories

Deletes one or more managed directories. To be deleted, a managed directory must be empty and not attached to any enabled export policies. Deleted managed directories cannot be recovered. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Directory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryExport

(REST API 2.3+) Delete directory exports

Deletes one or more directory exports. If any of the `ExportName` is not unique across the system, `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` must be specified to determine the exports. When server reference is not provided, the `_array_server` is set as effective default. The API provides two options for identifying an export object. One option is to reference it by its fully qualified export name, or alternatively, by a combination of parameters-specifically, the `ServerName` (or `ServerId`) and `ExportName`. All identifying parameters must always be provided, either explicitly or as part of the fully qualified name.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryExport [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-ExportName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-ServerId <List<String>>] [-ServerName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DirectoryId DirectoryIds Performs the operation on the unique managed directory IDs specified. Enter multiple managed directory IDs. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `fs:dir01,pod01::fs:dir01`. false False None
-ExportName ExportNames Performs the operation on the export names specified. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. Combines the export containment hierarchy (server), the protocol (smb or nfs) and the export_name. For example, `server01::smb::export01,server01::nfs::export01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `policy01,pod01::policy01`. false False None
-ServerId ServerIds A list of server IDs. false False None
-ServerName ServerNames Server names for which the export object is going to be evaluated. Names are expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `server01,server02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyAutodir

Delete a membership between a directory and one or more auto managed directory policies

Deletes a membership between a directory with one or more auto managed directory policies. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyAutodir [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyUserGroupQuota

Delete a membership between a directory and one or more user-group-quota policies

Deletes a membership between a directory and one or more user-group-quota policies. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyUserGroupQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for user-group-quota management operations. If set to `$True`, user/group usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` of user-group-quota rules. If set to `$False`, the impact of the user-group-quota operation is checked against the user/group usage in the managed directory and its ancestors and the operation is not allowed if the user/group usage would exceed any enforced user-group-quota limits. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryService

Delete directory services configuration

Deletes directory services configuration. Directory service configuration must not be referenced by any server nor enabled to be deleted. The built-in "management" directory service cannot be deleted.

Syntax

-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalDirectoryService

Delete local directory services

Deletes local directory services. Local directory service can't be deleted when referenced by any server. Known issue: cmdlet throws error when parameters -Id is provided. As a workaround, use -Name parameter.

-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroup

Delete local groups

Deletes one or more local groups. The `Gids`, `Name`, or `Sid` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Gids <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Sid <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Gids none Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceId LocalDirectoryServiceIds Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceName LocalDirectoryServiceNames Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Sid Sids Performs the operation on the object SID specified. Enter multiple SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroupMember

Delete local group membership

Deletes one or more local group memberships. The `GroupName`, `GroupSid`, or `GroupGid` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `MemberName`, `MemberSid`, or `member_gids` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroupMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupGid <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-GroupSid <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberSid <List<String>>] [-MemberType <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupGid GroupGids Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the group names specified. Enter multiple group names. For example, `group1,group2`. false False None
-GroupSid GroupSids Performs the operation on the specified group SID. Enter multiple group SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceId LocalDirectoryServiceIds Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceName LocalDirectoryServiceNames Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique local member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. For local group IDs refer to group IDs (GID). For local user IDs refer to user IDs (UID). The `MemberId` and `MemberName` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberSid MemberSids Performs the operation on the specified member SID. Enter multiple member SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-MemberType MemberTypes Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `directories`. Enter multiple member types. For example, `type01,type02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None

When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None

Remove-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) Delete directory snapshot

Deletes a directory snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated directory snapshots cannot be recovered. Directory snapshots are destroyed by using the Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete DirectorySnapshot false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

Remove-Pfa2Fleet

Delete a fleet

Deletes a fleet, permanently. A fleet can only be deleted if the current array is the only array in the fleet.

Syntax

Remove-Pfa2FleetMember

Delete fleet members

Deletes the specified array(s) from the fleet. Note that this will only succeed if the array(s) to be removed are not making use of any fleet resources.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2FleetMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Unreachable <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Unreachable none If set to `$True`, allows a one-sided disconnect when the connection status is `connecting` instead of `connected` or `partially connected`. If set to `$False`, it works just like normal coordinated disconnect. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

Remove-Pfa2Host

(REST API 2.0+) Delete a host

Deletes an existing host. All volumes that are connected to the host, either through private or shared connections, must be disconnected from the host before the host can be deleted. The `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Host [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None
