Remove-Pfa2HostGroupHost

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a membership from a host group

Deletes a membership from a host group. Removing a membership from a host group automatically disconnects the host from all volumes associated with the group. Hosts can be removed from host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2HostGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a host group from a protection group

Deletes a host group member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed are not affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Key Keys A list of tag keys. false False None
-Namespace Namespaces A list of namespaces. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None

Remove-Pfa2HostHostGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a membership from a host group

Deletes a membership from a host group. Deleting a membership from a host group automatically disconnects the host from all volumes associated with the group. Hosts can be deleted from host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.

Remove-Pfa2HostHostGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None

-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a host from a protection group

Deletes a host member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed are not affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2Pod

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a pod

Deletes (eradicates) a pod that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated pods cannot be recovered. Pods are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2Pod` cmdlet. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. If SafeMode is enabled then `Update-Pfa2Pod -DestroyContents $True -Destroyed $True` must be called first.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Pod [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-EradicateContents <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete Pod false False False
-EradicateContents none (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to eradicate contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups). This enables you to eradicate containers with contents. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2PodArray

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a pod that was stretched to an array

Deletes a pod that was stretchd to an array, collapsing the pod to a single array. Unstretch a pod from an array when the volumes within the stretched pod no longer need to be synchronously replicated between the two arrays. After a pod has been unstretched, synchronous replication stops. A destroyed version of the pod with 'restretch' appended to the pod name is created on the array that no longer has the pod. The restretched pod represents a point-in-time snapshot of the pod, just before it was unstretched. The restretch pod enters an eradication pending period starting from the time that the pod was unstretched. A restretched pod can be cloned or destroyed, but it cannot be explicitly recovered. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the pod to be unstretched. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array from which the pod is to be unstretched. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together. (Deprecated) Use pods/members instead.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2PodArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-WithUnknown <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-WithUnknown none If set to `$True`, unstretches the specified pod from the specified array by force. Use the `WithUnknown` parameter in the following rare event: the local array goes offline while the pod is still stretched across two arrays, the status of the remote array becomes unknown, and there is no guarantee that the pod is online elsewhere. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2PodReplicaLink

(REST API 2.2+) Delete pod replica links

Deletes pod replica links. The `LocalPodName` and `RemotePodName` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-LocalPodId LocalPodIds A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodName` query parameter. false False None
-LocalPodName LocalPodNames A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodId` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodId RemotePodIds A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodName` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodName RemotePodNames A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodId` query parameter. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberType MemberTypes Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `directories`. Enter multiple member types. For example, `type01,type02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `policy01,pod01::policy01`. false False None
-ServerId ServerIds A list of server IDs. false False None
-ServerName ServerNames Server names for which the export object is going to be evaluated. Names are expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `server01,server02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None

Remove-Pfa2PolicyUserGroupQuotaMember

Delete membership between user-group-quota policies and managed directories

Deletes a membership between one or more user-group-quota policies and managed directories. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2PolicyUserGroupQuotaMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for user-group-quota management operations. If set to `$True`, user/group usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` of user-group-quota rules. If set to `$False`, the impact of the user-group-quota operation is checked against the user/group usage in the managed directory and its ancestors and the operation is not allowed if the user/group usage would exceed any enforced user-group-quota limits. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-MemberType MemberTypes Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `directories`. Enter multiple member types. For example, `type01,type02`. false False None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a protection group

Deletes a protection group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated protection groups cannot be recovered. Protection groups are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup` method. The `Name` parameter is required.

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Remove-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete ProtectionGroup false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a host from a protection group

Deletes a host member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed will not be affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHostGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a host group from a protection group

Deletes a host group member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Protection group snapshots taken before the member was removed will not be affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a protection group snapshot

Deletes a protection group snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicating a protection group snapshot eradicates all of its protection group snapshots and cannot be recovered. Protection group snapshots are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot` method. The `Name` or `Id` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none (REST API 2.3+) Permanently delete ProtectionGroupSnapshot false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a target from a protection group

Deletes an array, pod, or offload target from a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array, pod, or offload target that is being removed from the protection group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a volume from a protection group

Deletes a volume member from a protection group. After the member has been deleted, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was deleted are not affected. Deleting a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` parameter, and either the `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Outputs

Remove-Pfa2Realm

Delete realms

Deletes realms that have been destroyed and are pending eradication. Eradicated realms cannot be recovered. Realms are destroyed using the Update-Pfa2Realm method.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Realm [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-Eradicate] [-EradicateContents <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-Eradicate none Permanently delete Realm false False False
-EradicateContents none Set to `$True` to eradicate contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups). This enables you to eradicate containers with contents. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a remote protection group

Deletes a remote protection group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated remote protection groups cannot be recovered. Remote protection groups are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup` method. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Id` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none (REST API 2.3+) Permanently delete RemoteProtectionGroup false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.4+) Delete a remote volume snapshot

Deletes a remote volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated remote volume snapshots cannot be recovered. Remote volume snapshots are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot` method. The `Name` parameter represents the name of the volume snapshot. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Name` and `On` parameters are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete RemoteVolumeSnapshot false False False
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-ReplicationSnapshot none If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CascadeDelete none The resource types to delete when deleting the object. It will fail if the resources are referenced by other objects. Valid values include `directory-services`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2Software

(REST API 2.11+) Delete a software package

Deletes a software package specified by software name and version. A software package being used for an installation can be deleted if the installation is `downloading`, `downloaded`, `aborted`, or `finished`. If the software package is currently `downloading`, the download will be cancelled.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Software [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-SoftwareVersion <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SoftwareVersion SoftwareVersions A list of target software versions. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2SoftwareCheck

(REST API 2.9+) Delete a software check task

Deletes a software check task specified by software name and version. The check task must be queued. If the check task is running or passed/failed then the task cannot be deleted.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2SoftwareCheck [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-SoftwareName <List<String>>] [-SoftwareVersion <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-SoftwareName SoftwareNames A list of software names. false False None
-SoftwareVersion SoftwareVersions A list of target software versions. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2Subnet

(REST API 2.2+) Delete subnet

Deletes subnets. A subnet can only be deleted if it has no interfaces. Interfaces must be removed by using the `network-interfaces` endpoint.

Syntax

Remove-Pfa2SyslogServer

(REST API 2.4+) Delete syslog server

Deletes a configured syslog server and stops forwarding syslog messages.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2SyslogServer [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Remove-Pfa2Vchost

Delete a vchost

Deletes an existing vchost. The `Name` or `Id` query parameter is required.

Syntax

Remove-Pfa2VchostCertificate

Delete a vchost certificate

Deletes an existing vchost certificate. The `Id` query parameter alone, or the `CertificateName` query parameter together with one of `VchostName` or `VchostId`, is required.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VchostCertificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CertificateName <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CertificateName CertificateNames The names of one or more certificates. Enter multiple names. For example, `cert01,cert02`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-VchostId VchostIds Performs the operation on the unique vchost IDs specified. Enter multiple vchost IDs in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. false False None
-VchostName VchostNames Performs the operation on the unique vchost name specified. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2VchostConnection

Delete the vchost-connection between a protocol endpoint and its vchost

Deletes the vchost-connection between a protocol endpoint and its vchost. The storage container represented by the protocol endpoint will no longer be visible to the vCenter represented by the vchost. One of the `ProtocolEndpointName` or `ProtocolEndpointId` query parameters, and one of the `VchostName` or `VchostId` query parameters are required. But if `AllVchosts` is set to `$True`, `VchostName` and `VchostId` should not be specified.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VchostConnection [-AllVchosts <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AllVchosts none If set to `$True`, the storage container represented by the protocol endpoint is accessible to all vchosts. Users should not specify `VchostId` or `VchostName` in the request. If set to `$False`, the storage container represented by the protocol endpoint is only accessible to the vchosts that have explicit vchost-connections with the protocol endpoint. Users need to specify `VchostId` or `VchostName` in the request. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointId ProtocolEndpointIds A list of protocol endpoint IDs. Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. For example, `peid01,peid02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `ProtocolEndpointName`. If the list contains more than one value, then `VchostId` or `VchostName` must have exactly one value. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointName ProtocolEndpointNames A list of protocol endpoint names. Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. For example, `pe01,pe02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `ProtocolEndpointId`. If the list contains more than one value, then `VchostId` or `VchostName` must have exactly one value. false False None
-VchostId VchostIds A list of vchost IDs. Performs the operation on the vchosts specified. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `VchostName`. If the list contains more than one value, then `ProtocolEndpointId` or `ProtocolEndpointName` must have exactly one value. false False None
-VchostName VchostNames A list of vchost names. Performs the operation on the vchosts specified. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `VchostId`. If the list contains more than one value, then `ProtocolEndpointId` or `ProtocolEndpointName` must have exactly one value. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Deletes an existing vchost endpoint The `Id` query parameter alone, or the `Endpoint` query parameter together with one of `VchostName` or `VchostId`, is required.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VchostEndpoint [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Endpoint <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Endpoint Endpoints Performs the operation on the unique endpoints specified. Enter multiple endpoints in a comma-separated format. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-VchostId VchostIds Performs the operation on the unique vchost IDs specified. Enter multiple vchost IDs in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. false False None
-VchostName VchostNames Performs the operation on the unique vchost name specified. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. false False None

Remove-Pfa2Volume

(REST API 2.0+) Delete a volume

Deletes (eradicates) a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated volumes cannot be recovered. Volumes are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2Volume` cmdlet. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Volume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete Volume false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a volume group

Deletes a volume group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated volume groups cannot be recovered. Volume groups are destroyed through the Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-EradicateContents <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete VolumeGroup false False False
-EradicateContents none (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to eradicate contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups). This enables you to eradicate containers with contents. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroupTag

Delete tags

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroupTag [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Key <List<String>>] [-Namespace <List<String>>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Key Keys A list of tag keys. false False None
-Namespace Namespaces A list of namespaces. Only one namespace is allowed per delete request. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Delete a volume from a protection group

Deletes a volume member from a protection group. After the member has been deleted, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was deleted are not affected. Deleting a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` and only one of `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.0+) Delete a volume snapshot

Deletes a volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated volume snapshots cannot be recovered. Volume snapshots are destroyed by using the `Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot` method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete VolumeSnapshot false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ReplicationSnapshot none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None

Remove-Pfa2Workload

Delete a workload

Deletes a workload that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated workloads cannot be recovered. Workloads are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2Workload` method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2Workload [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Confirm cf Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet. false False False
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Eradicate none Permanently delete Workload false False False
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Only one value is supported. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique resource names specified. Only one value is supported. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WhatIf wi Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run. false False False
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Remove-Pfa2WorkloadTag

Delete tags

Deletes specified tags.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2WorkloadTag [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Key <List<String>>] [-Namespace <List<String>>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Key Keys A list of tag keys. false False None
-Namespace Namespaces A list of namespaces. Only one namespace is allowed per delete request. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

reference: CloudProviderTag		 false False None

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: NonCopyableTag		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None
