Set-Pfa2PresetWorkload

Update a workload preset

Updates a workload preset by replacing it with the new contents in `preset`. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Set-Pfa2PresetWorkload [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Description <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ParametersConstraintsBooleanDefault <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerDefault <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMaximum <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMinimum <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceAllowedValuesResourceType <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultId <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultName <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultResourceType <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsStringAllowedValues <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-ParametersConstraintsStringDefault <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataDescription <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataDisplayName <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataSubtype <List<String>>] [-ParametersName <List<String>>] [-ParametersType <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRemoteTargets <Hashtable[]>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsQosConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassId <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassName <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassResourceType <List<String>>] [-PresetName <String>] [-QosConfigurationsBandwidthLimit <List<String>>] [-QosConfigurationsIopsLimit <List<String>>] [-QosConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesAt <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesEvery <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesKeepFor <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsCount <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsPeriodicReplicationConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-VolumeConfigurationsPlacementConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-VolumeConfigurationsProvisionedSize <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsSnapshotConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-WorkloadTagsCopyable <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsKey <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsValue <List<String>>] [-WorkloadType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Description none A brief description of the workload the preset will configure. Supports up to 1KB of unicode characters. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Only one value is supported. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique resource names specified. Only one value is supported. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ParametersConstraintsBooleanDefault none The default value to use if no value is provided.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsBoolean		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues none The valid values that can be supplied to the parameter. A parameter that collects the number of volumes to provision might, for example, limit the allowed values to a few fixed options. Supports up to five values.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsInteger		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsIntegerDefault none The default value to use if no value is provided. Must be present in `ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues`, if set. Must comply with `ParametersConstraintsIntegerMinimum`, if set. Must comply with `ParametersConstraintsIntegerMaximum`, if set.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsInteger		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMaximum none The maximum acceptable value, inclusive.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsInteger		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMinimum none The minimum acceptable value, inclusive.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsInteger		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceAllowedValuesResourceType none ">The type of resource the parameter references. Valid values include `storage-classes` and `remote-arrays`. false False None
-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsStringAllowedValues none The valid values that can be supplied to the parameter. A parameter that collects the name of the environment to which a workload will deploy might, for example, limit the allowed values to `production`, `testing` and `development`. Supports up to five values, with up to 64 unicode characters per value.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsString		 false False None
-ParametersConstraintsStringDefault none The default value to use if no value is provided. Must be present in `ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues`, if `ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues` is set. Supports up to 64 unicode characters.


reference: PresetWorkloadConstraintsString		 false False None
-ParametersMetadataDescription none A brief description of the parameter and how it is used within the preset. Supports up to 1KB of unicode characters.


reference: PresetWorkloadMetadata		 false False None
-ParametersMetadataDisplayName none The human-friendly name of the parameter, which will be shown in the GUI instead of the standard name if configured. Supports up to 64 unicode characters.


reference: PresetWorkloadMetadata		 false False None
-ParametersMetadataSubtype none The subtype of the parameter, which the GUI will use to contextualize the prompt for the parameter value. For example, when set to size, the GUI will display an input field with a dropdown menu that contains common size units such as MB, GB, TB, etc. Valid values include `size`, `iops`, `bandwidth`, `time` and `duration`. Subtype can only be used with integer parameters.


reference: PresetWorkloadMetadata		 false False None
-ParametersName none The name of the parameter, by which other fields in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all parameters in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadParameter		 false False None
-ParametersType none The type of the parameter. Valid values include `string`, `integer`, `boolean` and `resource_reference`. String parameters can be used to collect metadata about workloads deployed from the preset, such as the environment to which they are deployed (e.g., production, development, etc.) or the billing account to which they belong for charge back and show back purposes. Integer and boolean parameters can be used to configure specific fields in the preset, such as the number or size of volumes to provision. Resource reference parameters can be used to collect references to other objects, such as storage classes or remote arrays.


reference: PresetWorkloadParameter		 false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsName none The name of the periodic replication configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadPeriodicReplicationConfiguration		 false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRemoteTargets none The remote targets to which snapshots may be replicated. Provide 1 value(s).


reference: PresetWorkloadPeriodicReplicationConfiguration		 false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt none ">Specifies the number of milliseconds since midnight at which to take a snapshot. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value cannot be set if the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value is not measured in days. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value can only be set on the first rule. false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery none ">Specifies the interval between snapshots, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value for all rules must be multiples of one another. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and 400 days for the first rule. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and one day for the second rule. false False None
-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor none ">Specifies the period that snapshots are retained before they are eradicated, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 24855 days for the first rule, and a multiple of a second. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 2147483647 days for the second rule, and must be greater than or equal to the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value of the first rule. false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsName none The name of the placement configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadPlacementConfiguration		 false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsQosConfigurations none The names of the QoS configurations to apply to the storage resources (such as volumes) in the placement. The limits defined in the QoS configurations will be shared across all storage resources in the placement. Provide at most 1 value(s).


reference: PresetWorkloadPlacementConfiguration		 false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-PresetName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-QosConfigurationsBandwidthLimit none The QoS IOPs limit shared across all volumes in the placement. Between 100 and 100000000, inclusive. Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration		 false False None
-QosConfigurationsIopsLimit none The maximum QoS bandwidth limit shared across all volumes in the placement. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Between 1MB/s and 512 GB/s, inclusive. Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration		 false False None
-QosConfigurationsName none The name of the QoS configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration		 false False None
-SnapshotConfigurationsName none The name of the snapshot configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadSnapshotConfiguration		 false False None
-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesAt none ">Specifies the number of milliseconds since midnight at which to take a snapshot. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value cannot be set if the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value is not measured in days. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value can only be set on the first rule. false False None
-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesEvery none ">Specifies the interval between snapshots, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value for all rules must be multiples of one another. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and 400 days for the first rule. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and one day for the second rule. false False None
-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesKeepFor none ">Specifies the period that snapshots are retained before they are eradicated, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 24855 days for the first rule, and a multiple of a second. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 2147483647 days for the second rule, and must be greater than or equal to the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value of the first rule. false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsCount none The number of volumes to provision. Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsName none The name of the volume configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsPeriodicReplicationConfigurations none The names of the periodic replication configurations to apply to the volumes.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsPlacementConfigurations none The names of the placement configurations with which to associate the volumes. Provide 1 value(s).


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsProvisionedSize none The virtual size of each volume. Measured in bytes and must be a multiple of 512. The maximum size is 4503599627370496 (4PB). Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-VolumeConfigurationsSnapshotConfigurations none The names of the snapshot configurations to apply to the volumes.


reference: PresetWorkloadVolumeConfiguration		 false False None
-WorkloadTagsCopyable none Specifies whether to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.


reference: PresetWorkloadWorkloadTag		 false False None
-WorkloadTagsKey none Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.


reference: PresetWorkloadWorkloadTag		 false False None
-WorkloadTagsNamespace none Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `ParametersConstraintsBooleanDefault`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.


reference: PresetWorkloadWorkloadTag		 false False None
-WorkloadTagsValue none Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters. Supports parameterization.


reference: PresetWorkloadWorkloadTag		 false False None
-WorkloadType none The type of workload the preset will configure. Valid values include `VDI`, `File`, `MySQL` etc. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Set-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotTagBatch

Update tags

Updates or creates tags for all specified objects.

Syntax 

Set-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotTagBatch [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagResourceId <List<String>>] [-TagResourceName <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: TagBatch		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: TagBatch		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: TagBatch		 false False None
-TagResourceId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-TagResourceName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: TagBatch		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

(REST API 2.2+) Update tags

Updates tags.

Syntax 

Set-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTagsBatch [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagResourceId <List<String>>] [-TagResourceName <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-ResourceId ResourceIds A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ResourceName ResourceNames A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-TagCopyable TagsCopyable (REST API 2.3+) Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: TagBatch		 false False None
-TagKey TagsKey (REST API 2.3+) Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: TagBatch		 false False None
-TagNamespace TagsNamespace (REST API 2.3+) Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: TagBatch		 false False None
-TagResourceId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-TagResourceName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-TagValue TagsValue (REST API 2.3+) Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters. Provide at least 1 value(s) and at most 30 value(s).


reference: TagBatch		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2ActiveDirectory

(REST API 2.15+) Modify Active Directory account

Modifies specified Active Directory account.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ActiveDirectory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] -Name <String> [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Tls <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-Tls none TLS mode for communication with domain controllers. Valid values are `required` and `optional`. `required` forces TLS communication with domain controller. `optional` allows the use of non-TLS communication, TLS will still be preferred, if available. If not specified, defaults to `required`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Admin

(REST API 2.2+) Modify an administrator

Modifies properties for the specified administrator.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Admin [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Locked <Boolean>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesId <List<String>>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesName <List<String>>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesResourceType <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-OldPassword <SecureString>] [-Password <SecureString>] [-PublicKey <String>] [-RoleName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Locked none Returns a value of `$True` if the user is currently locked out. otherwise `$False`. Change to `$False` to unlock a user. This field is only visible to `array_admin` roles. For all other users, the value is always `null`. false False None
-ManagementAccessPoliciesId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ManagementAccessPoliciesName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-ManagementAccessPoliciesResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.


reference: ReferenceWithType		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-OldPassword none The current password. false False None
-Password none Password associated with the account. false False None
-PublicKey none Public key for SSH access. Multiple public keys can be specified, separated by newlines. false False None
-RoleName RoleNames This field has been deprecated. Predecessor to management access policies. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2AdminSetting

(REST API 2.2+) Modify administrator settings

Modifies the global administrator settings for the array.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2AdminSetting [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-LockoutDuration <Int64>] [-MaxLoginAttempts <Int32>] [-MinPasswordLength <Int32>] [-RequiredAuthenticationMethodsSsh <List<String>>] [-RequiredAuthenticationMethodsWebUi <List<String>>] [-SingleSignOnEnabled <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-LockoutDuration none The lockout duration, in milliseconds, if a user is locked out after reaching the maximum number of login attempts. Ranges from 1 second to 90 days.


minimum: 1000


maximum: 7776000000		 false False None
-MaxLoginAttempts none Maximum number of failed login attempts allowed before the user is locked out.


minimum: 1


maximum: 20		 false False None
-MinPasswordLength none Minimum password length. If not specified, defaults to 1. false False None
-RequiredAuthenticationMethodsSsh none Authentication methods that are required for the array on specific user interfaces. Authentication methods that are required for the array on specific user interfaces. false False None
-RequiredAuthenticationMethodsWebUi none Authentication methods that are required for the array on specific user interfaces. Authentication methods that are required for the array on specific user interfaces. false False None
-SingleSignOnEnabled none If `$True`, then single sign-on is enabled for the array. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • None

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Flagged none If set to `$True`, the message is flagged. Important messages can can be flagged and listed separately. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2AlertRule

Modify a custom alert rule

Modifies a custom alert rule to a new value.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2AlertRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] -Code <Int32> -Parameter <String> [-Value <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Code none The alert code that the rule applies to. Available alert codes for customization can be found in the alert rules catalog. true False None
-Parameter none The parameter of the custom alert rule to modify. Values include `info` and `warning`. Available parameter values can be found in the alert rules catalog. true False None
-Value none The value to use for the custom alert rule. Valid values for an alert code and parameter combination can be found in the alert rules catalog. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Array

(REST API 2.2+) Modify an array

Modifies general array properties such as the array name, login banner, idle timeout for management sessions, and NTP servers.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ArrayName <String>] [-Banner <String>] [-ConsoleLockEnabled <Boolean>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-EradicationConfigDisabledDelay <Int64>] [-EradicationConfigEnabledDelay <Int64>] [-EradicationDelay <Int64>] [-IdleTimeout <Int32>] [-NtpServer <List<String>>] [-NtpSymmetricKey <String>] [-ScsiTimeout <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ArrayName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-Banner none Sets text that Purity users see in the GUI at login, and in the CLI just before the password prompt. false False None
-ConsoleLockEnabled none Enables or disables root user login at the physical (serial or VGA) console. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-EradicationConfigDisabledDelay none The configuration of eradication feature. The configuration of eradication feature. false False None
-EradicationConfigEnabledDelay none The configuration of eradication feature. The configuration of eradication feature. false False None
-EradicationDelay EradicationConfigEradicationDelay (REST API 2.6+) The configuration of eradication feature. The configuration of eradication feature. false False None
-IdleTimeout none The idle timeout in milliseconds. Valid values include `0` and any multiple of `60000` in the range of `300000` and `10800000`. Any other values are rounded down to the nearest multiple of `60000`. false False None
-NtpServer NtpServers NTP Servers. If the user does not have sufficient access, this field will return `null`. false False None
-NtpSymmetricKey none The text of ntp symmetric authentication key. Supported formats include a hex-encoded string no longer than 64 characters, or an ASCII string no longer than 20 characters, excluding "#". Any configured key will be masked as " * *" on return. If the user does not have sufficient access, this field will return `null`. false False None
-ScsiTimeout none The SCSI timeout. If not specified, defaults to `60s`. If the user does not have sufficient access, this field will return `null`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2ArrayCloudCapacity

Modify CBS array capacity

Modifies the raw capacity of the CBS array. This should trigger a backend process that will update the CBS array capacity. The array capacity can be updated only to values defined by the capacity steps endpoint. When an existing capacity update request is in progress, any new request to update of the capacity will receive an error response. For non-CBS arrays, this feature is not supported and requests will receive an error response.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ArrayCloudCapacity [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-RequestedCapacity <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-RequestedCapacity none The requested raw capacity of the CBS array in bytes. When the capacity update process finishes, it should be the same as `current_capacity`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection

(REST API 2.4+) Modify an array connection

Modifies attributes for an array connection.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ConnectionKey <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DefaultLimit <Int64>] [-Encryption <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-ManagementAddress <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Refresh <Boolean>] [-RenewEncryptionKey <Boolean>] [-ReplicationAddress <List<String>>] [-ThrottleDefaultLimit <Int64>] [-ThrottleWindowEnd <Int64>] [-ThrottleWindowLimit <Int64>] [-ThrottleWindowStart <Int64>] [-Type <String>] [-WindowEnd <Int64>] [-WindowLimit <Int64>] [-WindowStart <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ConnectionKey none The connection key of the target array. It is required when `Encryption` is changed, or when `Type` is changed from `async-replication` to `sync-replication`. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DefaultLimit none Deprecated. Default maximum bandwidth threshold for outbound traffic in bytes. Once exceeded, bandwidth throttling occurs. false False None
-Encryption none If `encrypted`, encryption will be enabled for all traffic over this array connection. If `unencrypted`, encryption will be disabled for all traffic over this array connection. `ConnectionKey` must be specified when encryption is changed. If not specified, the current encryption option for the array connection will remain unchanged. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ManagementAddress none Management IP address of the target array. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Refresh none If set to `$True`, the array will attempt to communicate with the connection peer in order to update the connection attributes on both arrays with any changes that have occurred. If set to `$True`, other array connection attributes may not be modified in requests. Default value is `$False`. false False None
-RenewEncryptionKey none If set to `$True`, update array connection with a new encryption key. If set to `$True`, other array connection attributes may not be modified in requests. Defaults to `$False`. false False None
-ReplicationAddress ReplicationAddresses IP addresses and FQDNs of the target arrays. Configurable only when `replication_transport` is set to `ip`. false False None
-ThrottleDefaultLimit none The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. false False None
-ThrottleWindowEnd none The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. false False None
-ThrottleWindowLimit none The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. false False None
-ThrottleWindowStart none The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only. false False None
-Type none The type of replication. Valid values are `async-replication` and `sync-replication`. false False None
-WindowEnd none The window end time. Measured in milliseconds since midnight. The time must be set on the hour. (e.g., `28800000`, which is equal to 8:00 AM). false False None
-WindowLimit none Deprecated. Maximum bandwidth threshold for outbound traffic during the specified `WindowLimit` time range in bytes. Once exceeded, bandwidth throttling occurs. false False None
-WindowStart none The window start time. Measured in milliseconds since midnight. The time must be set on the hour. (e.g., `18000000`, which is equal to 5:00 AM). false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Certificate

(REST API 2.4+) Modify certificates

Modifies certificate attributes. Modifying self-signed certificate attributes replaces the existing certificate with a new one, generated by Purity//FA, using the specified attributes.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Certificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Certificate <String>] [-CommonName <String>] [-Country <String>] [-Days <Int32>] [-Email <String>] [-GenerateNewKey <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IntermediateCertificate <String>] [-Key <String>] [-KeyAlgorithm <String>] [-KeySize <Int32>] [-Locality <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Organization <String>] [-OrganizationalUnit <String>] [-Passphrase <String>] [-State <String>] [-SubjectAlternativeNames <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Certificate none The text of the certificate. false False None
-CommonName none The common name field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Country none Two-letter country (ISO) code listed in the certificate. false False None
-Days none The number of days that the self-signed certificate is valid. Defaults to 3650. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate. false False None
-Email none The email field listed in the certificate. false False None
-GenerateNewKey none If set to `$True`, a new private key is generated when generating a new certificate with the specified attributes. This may not be set to `$True` when importing a certificate and private key, and may not be set to `$False` when generating a new self-signed certificate to replace a certificate that was imported. Default setting is `$False`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-IntermediateCertificate none The text of the intermediate certificate chains. false False None
-Key Keys The text of the private key. This field can only be specified when importing a certificate and key pair. false False None
-KeyAlgorithm none The key algorithm used to generate the certificate. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate. Defaults to rsa if not specified. Valid values when creating a new self-signed certificate only include `rsa`, `ec`, `ed448` and `ed25519`. false False None
-KeySize none The size (in bits) of the private key for the certificate. Default is 2048 bits for `rsa` key_algorithm, 256 for `ec` and `ed25519`. The `ed448` default key size is 456. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate. false False None
-Locality none The locality field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Organization none The organization field listed in the certificate. false False None
-OrganizationalUnit none The organizational unit field listed in the certificate. false False None
-Passphrase none The passphrase used to encrypt `Key`. This field can only be specified when importing a certificate and key pair. false False None
-State none The state/province field listed in the certificate. false False None
-SubjectAlternativeNames none The alternative names that are secured by this certificate. Alternative names may be IP addresses, DNS names, or URIs. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DefaultProtectionsId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: DefaultProtectionReference		 false False None
-DefaultProtectionsName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: DefaultProtectionReference		 false False None
-DefaultProtectionsReset none Clear the list of default protections. false False False
-DefaultProtectionsType none The type of default protection. Currently, the only valid value is `protection_group`.


reference: DefaultProtectionReference		 false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the container ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Specifying `Id` or `Name` with no value will perform the operation on local array. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique container name specified. Enter multiple names. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Specifying `Id` or `Name` with no value will perform the operation on local array. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Update-Pfa2Directory

(REST API 2.3+) Modify a managed directory

Modifies a managed directory. To rename a managed directory, set `name` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `name` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Directory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DirectoryName DirectoryNames The managed directory name without the file system name prefix. A full managed directory name is constructed in the form of `FILE_SYSTEM:DIR` where `FILE_SYSTEM` is the file system name and `DIR` is the value of this field. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2DirectoryService

(REST API 2.2+) Modify directory services configuration

Modifies the directory service configuration.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectoryService [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-BaseDn <String>] [-BindPassword <SecureString>] [-BindUser <String>] [-CaCertificate <String>] [-CaCertificateRefId <String>] [-CaCertificateRefName <String>] [-CaCertificateRefResourceType <String>] [-CheckPeer <Boolean>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DirectoryServiceName <String>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-ManagementSshPublicKeyAttribute <String>] [-ManagementUserLoginAttribute <String>] [-ManagementUserObjectClass <String>] [-Name <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Uri <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-BaseDn none Base of the Distinguished Name (DN) of the directory service groups. false False None
-BindPassword none Masked password used to query the directory. false False None
-BindUser none Username used to query the directory. false False None
-CaCertificate none The certificate of the Certificate Authority (CA) that signed the directory servers' certificate(s), which is used to validate the authenticity of the configured servers. Deprecated, please use ca_certificate_ref instead. Setting this field will result in ca_certificate_ref being updated to legacy_ds_ca_certificate <config_name>. false False None
-CaCertificateRefId none Reference (ID, name, and resource type) of the Certificate Authority (CA) that signed the certificates of the directory servers, which is used to validate the authenticity of the configured servers. false False None
-CaCertificateRefName none Reference (ID, name, and resource type) of the Certificate Authority (CA) that signed the certificates of the directory servers, which is used to validate the authenticity of the configured servers. false False None
-CaCertificateRefResourceType none Reference (ID, name, and resource type) of the Certificate Authority (CA) that signed the certificates of the directory servers, which is used to validate the authenticity of the configured servers. Reference (ID, name, and resource type) of the Certificate Authority (CA) that signed the certificates of the directory servers, which is used to validate the authenticity of the configured servers. false False None
-CheckPeer none Determines whether or not server authenticity is enforced when a certificate is provided. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DirectoryServiceName none (REST API 2.3+) The new name for the resource. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,realm01::name01,realm01::pod01::name01`. false False None
-Enabled none The directory service is either enabled or disabled. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-ManagementSshPublicKeyAttribute none Properties specific to the management service. Properties specific to the management service. false False None
-ManagementUserLoginAttribute none (REST API 2.3+) Properties specific to the management service. Properties specific to the management service. false False None
-ManagementUserObjectClass none (REST API 2.3+) Properties specific to the management service. Properties specific to the management service. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-SourceId SourceIds A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-Uri Uris List of URIs for the configured directory servers. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

When not set, it defaults to name of the Local Directory Service. For example, for object "mydomain" the domain name will be "mydomain" where domain name does not have any unique constraint (it can be the same for different local directory services within an array. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None

The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroup

Modify local groups

Modifies local groups. The `Gids`, `Name`, or `Sid` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Email <String>] [-Gid <Int32>] [-Gids <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] [-LocalGroupName <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Sid <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Email none The email address of the local group. false False None
-Gid none The POSIX user ID of this object (group ID). false False None
-Gids none Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceId LocalDirectoryServiceIds Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceName LocalDirectoryServiceNames Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None
-LocalGroupName none The local group name. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Sid Sids Performs the operation on the object SID specified. Enter multiple SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUser

Modify local user

Modifies a local user.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUser [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Email <String>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-KeepOpenSession <Boolean>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceId <List<String>>] [-LocalDirectoryServiceName <List<String>>] [-LocalUserName <String>] [-Name <String>] [-NewUid <Int32>] [-Password <String>] [-PrimaryGroupId <String>] [-PrimaryGroupName <String>] [-PrimaryGroupResourceType <String>] [-Sid <List<String>>] [-Uid <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Email none Optional field to set the email of the local user. false False None
-Enabled none If this field is `$False`, the local user will be disabled on creation. Otherwise, the local user will be enabled and functional from the beginning. false False None
-KeepOpenSession KeepOpenSessions If set to `$True`, the session does not expire. If set to `$False`, when the user is disabled or password is changed, the session expires. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceId LocalDirectoryServiceIds Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceName` parameter. false False None
-LocalDirectoryServiceName LocalDirectoryServiceNames Performs the operation on the specified local directory service. Supports exactly one value. When not specified, the local directory service connected to the `_array_server` will be used. This cannot be provided in conjunction with the `LocalDirectoryServiceId` parameter. false False None
-LocalUserName none The local user name. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-NewUid none Optional field to set the UID of the local user. false False None
-Password none The password of the local user. This field is only required if the `Enabled` field is $True. false False None
-PrimaryGroupId none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-PrimaryGroupName none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-PrimaryGroupResourceType none Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. Local group that would be assigned as the primary group of the local user. false False None
-Sid Sids Performs the operation on the object SID specified. Enter multiple SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`. false False None
-Uid Uids A list of local user IDs (UIDs). Enter multiple local user IDs. For example, `423,51234`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole

(REST API 2.2+) Modify group to management access policy mappings

Modifies properties of one or more group to management access policy mappings. Modifying management access policies is done at `/directory-services/roles/policies/management-access` instead.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Group <String>] [-GroupBase <String>] -Name <String> [-NewRoleName <String>] [-RoleName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Group none Group name that contains users with the abilities granted by the associated policies. false False None
-GroupBase none Specifies where the configured group is located in the directory tree. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique names specified. For example, `GroupRoleMappingName`. Enter multiple names. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-NewRoleName none This field has been deprecated. Predecessor to management access policies. false False None
-RoleName RoleNames (REST API 2.3+) This field has been deprecated. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot

(REST API 2.3+) Modify directory snapshot

Modifies a directory snapshot. You can destroy, recover, or update the policy or time remaining of a directory snapshot. To destroy a directory snapshot, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a directory snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. To rename a directory snapshot, set `DirectorySnapshotName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ClientName <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-DirectorySnapshotName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-KeepFor <Int64>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ClientName none (REST API 2.9+) The client name portion of the client-visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the value of this field, and `SUFFIX` is the suffix. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. The client name of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable. If the `DirectorySnapshotName` and `ClientName` parameters are both specified, `ClientName` must match the client name portion of `DirectorySnapshotName`. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-DirectorySnapshotName none (REST API 2.9+) The new name of a directory snapshot. The name of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-KeepFor none The amount of time to keep the snapshots, in milliseconds. Can only be set on snapshots that are not managed by any snapshot policy. Set to `""` to clear the keep_for value. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyId PolicyIds The snapshot policy that manages this snapshot. Set to `DirectorySnapshotName` or `PolicyId` to `""` to clear the policy. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The snapshot policy that manages this snapshot. Set to `DirectorySnapshotName` or `PolicyId` to `""` to clear the policy. false False None
-Suffix none (REST API 2.9+) The suffix portion of the client-visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the client name, and `SUFFIX` is the value of this field. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. The suffix of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable. If the `DirectorySnapshotName` and `Suffix` parameters are both specified, `Suffix` must match the suffix portion of `DirectorySnapshotName`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Dns

(REST API 2.2+) Modify DNS parameters

Modifies the DNS parameters of an array, including the domain suffix, the list of DNS name server IP addresses, and the list of services that DNS parameters apply to. If there is no DNS configuration beforehand new DNS configuration with 'default' name is created. If more than one DNS configuration exists, `DnsName` has to be specified to identify the DNS configuration to be modified.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Dns [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CaCertificateGroupId <String>] [-CaCertificateGroupName <String>] [-CaCertificateGroupResourceType <String>] [-CaCertificateId <String>] [-CaCertificateName <String>] [-CaCertificateResourceType <String>] [-DnsName <String>] [-Domain <String>] [-Name <String>] [-NameServer <List<String>>] [-Service <List<String>>] [-SourceName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CaCertificateGroupId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified. false False None
-CaCertificateGroupName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on. false False None
-CaCertificateGroupResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc. false False None
-CaCertificateId none A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified. false False None
-CaCertificateName none The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on. false False None
-CaCertificateResourceType none Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc. false False None
-DnsName none (REST API 2.15+) The new name for the resource. false False None
-Domain none The domain suffix to be appended by the appliance when performing DNS lookups. false False None
-Name none (REST API 2.15+) Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-NameServer Nameservers The list of DNS servers either in the form of IP addresses or HTTPS endpoints. Domain names in HTTPS endpoints are not supported. IP addresses must be used instead. If nameservers begin with `https://`, then DNS queries will be performed over HTTPS. Otherwise, unencrypted DNS queries will be performed. Using a combination of nameservers that begin with `https://` and that do not begin with `https://` is not supported. If servers are specified with `https://` one of `ca_certificate` and `ca_certificate_group` parameters must be set. false False None
-Service Services The list of services utilizing the DNS configuration. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames (REST API 2.15+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Drive

Modifies flash and NVRAM modules that have been added or connected but not yet admitted to the array.

Update-Pfa2FileSystem

(REST API 2.3+) Modify a file system

Modifies a file system. You can rename, destroy, move, or recover a file system. To rename a file system, set `FileSystemName` to the new name. To destroy a file system, set `Destroyed=$True`. To move a file system, set 'pod' to the destination pod reference. To recover a file system that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2FileSystem [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-FileSystemName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-FileSystemName FileSystemNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PodId none (REST API 2.13+) The pod to move existing file systems into. false False None
-PodName none (REST API 2.13+) The pod to move existing file systems into. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Only one value is supported. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique resource names specified. Only one value is supported. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
