Update-Pfa2Host

(REST API 2.0+) Modify a host

Modifies an existing host, including its storage network addresses, CHAP, host personality, and preferred arrays, or associate a host to a host group. The `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Host [-AddIqn <List<String>>] [-AddNqn <List<String>>] [-AddWwn <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ChapHostPassword <String>] [-ChapHostUser <String>] [-ChapTargetPassword <String>] [-ChapTargetUser <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-FromMemberId <List<String>>] [-FromMemberNames <List<String>>] [-HostGroupName <String>] [-HostName <String>] [-Iqn <List<String>>] [-ModifyResourceAccess <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Nqn <List<String>>] [-Personality <String>] [-PreferredArraysId <List<String>>] [-PreferredArraysName <List<String>>] [-RemoveIqn <List<String>>] [-RemoveNqn <List<String>>] [-RemoveWwn <List<String>>] [-ToMemberId <List<String>>] [-ToMemberName <List<String>>] [-Vlan <String>] [-Wwn <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddIqn AddIqns Adds the specified iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-AddNqn AddNqns Adds the specified NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-AddWwn AddWwns Adds the specified Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ChapHostPassword none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapHostUser none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapTargetPassword none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ChapTargetUser none (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-FromMemberId FromMemberIds Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays from which the resource should be removed. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format. false False None
-FromMemberNames none Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays to be removed from the specified resource. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames The host group to which the host should be associated. false False None
-HostName HostNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-Iqn Iqns The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) associated with the host. false False None
-ModifyResourceAccess none Describes how to modify a resource accesses of a resource when that resource is moved. Possible values are: `none`, `create`, and `delete`. The `none` value indicates that no resource access should be modified. The `create` value is used when a resource is moving out of a realm into the array and it needs to create a resource access of the moved resource to the realm from which it is moving. The `delete` value is used when a resource that is moving from an array into a realm already has a resource access into that realm. This is a required parameter when a resource is being moved to another member. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Nqn Nqns The NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Personality none Determines how the system tunes the array to ensure that it works optimally with the host. Set `Personality` to the name of the host operating system or virtual memory system. Valid values are `aix`, `esxi`, `hitachi-vsp`, `hpux`, `oracle-vm-server`, `solaris`, and `vms`. If your system is not listed as one of the valid host personalities, do not set the option. By default, the personality is not set. false False None
-PreferredArraysId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-PreferredArraysName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-RemoveIqn RemoveIqns Disassociates the specified iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) from the specified host. false False None
-RemoveNqn RemoveNqns Disassociates the specified NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs) from the specified host. false False None
-RemoveWwn RemoveWwns Disassociates the specified Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs) from the specified host. false False None
-ToMemberId ToMemberIds The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format. false False None
-ToMemberName ToMemberNames The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-Vlan none The VLAN ID that the host is associated with. If not set, there is no change in VLAN. If set to `any`, the host can access any VLAN. If set to `untagged`, the host can only access untagged VLANs. If set to a number between `1` and `4094`, the host can only access the specified VLAN with that number. false False None
-Wwn Wwns The Fibre Channel World Wide Name (WWN) associated with the host. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2HostGroup

(REST API 2.0+) Modify a host group

Modifies a host group in which the `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2HostGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-FromMemberId <List<String>>] [-FromMemberNames <List<String>>] [-HostGroupName <String>] [-ModifyResourceAccess <String>] [-Name <String>] [-ToMemberId <List<String>>] [-ToMemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-FromMemberId FromMemberIds Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays from which the resource should be removed. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format. false False None
-FromMemberNames none Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays to be removed from the specified resource. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-HostGroupName HostGroupNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-ModifyResourceAccess none Describes how to modify a resource accesses of a resource when that resource is moved. Possible values are: `none`, `create`, and `delete`. The `none` value indicates that no resource access should be modified. The `create` value is used when a resource is moving out of a realm into the array and it needs to create a resource access of the moved resource to the realm from which it is moving. The `delete` value is used when a resource that is moving from an array into a realm already has a resource access into that realm. This is a required parameter when a resource is being moved to another member. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ToMemberId ToMemberIds The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format. false False None
-ToMemberName ToMemberNames The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2NetworkInterface

Modifies a network interface on a controller.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2NetworkInterface [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-AttachedServerId <List<String>>] [-AttachedServerName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-EthAddSubinterfaceName <List<String>>] [-EthAddress <String>] [-EthGateway <String>] [-EthMtu <Int32>] [-EthNetmask <String>] [-EthRemoveSubinterfaceName <List<String>>] [-EthSubinterfaceName <List<String>>] [-EthSubnetName <String>] [-Name <String>] [-OverrideNpivCheck <Boolean>] [-Service <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

-AttachedServerId AttachedServersId A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-AttachedServerName AttachedServersName The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None

-EthAddSubinterfaceName EthAddSubinterfacesName The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: ReferenceNoId		 false False None

reference: ReferenceNoId		 false False None

reference: ReferenceNoId		 false False None
-EthSubnetName none Ethernet network interface properties. Ethernet network interface properties. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-OverrideNpivCheck none N-Port ID Virtualization (NPIV) requires a balanced configuration of Fibre Channel ports configured for SCSI on both controllers. Enabling or Disabling a Fibre Channel port configured for SCSI might cause the NPIV status to change from enabled to disabled or vice versa. Set this option to proceed with enabling or disabling the port. false False None
-Service Services The services provided by the specified network interface or Fibre Channel port. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2Pod

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a pod

Modifies pod details.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Pod [-AbortQuiesce <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-FailoverPreferencesId <List<String>>] [-FailoverPreferencesName <List<String>>] [-FromMemberId <List<String>>] [-FromMemberNames <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Mediator <String>] [-MoveWithHostGroupName <List<String>>] [-MoveWithHostName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PromoteFrom <String>] [-Quiesce <Boolean>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-SkipQuiesce <Boolean>] [-ToMemberId <List<String>>] [-ToMemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AbortQuiesce none (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to promote the pod when the `pod-replica-link` is in the `quiescing` state and abort when waiting for the `pod-replica-link` to complete the quiescing operation. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DestroyContents none (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to destroy contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups), including eradicating containers with content. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, the pod has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed pod is permanently eradicated. A pod can only be destroyed if it is empty, so before destroying a pod, ensure all volumes and protection groups inside the pod have been either moved out of the pod or destroyed. A stretched pod cannot be destroyed unless you unstretch it first. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed pod can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the pod is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-FailoverPreferencesId none (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-FailoverPreferencesName none (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.


reference: Reference		 false False None
-FromMemberId FromMemberIds Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays from which the resource should be removed. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format. false False None
-FromMemberNames none Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays to be removed from the specified resource. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Set to `$True` to set a `QuotaLimit` that is lower than the existing usage. This ensures that no new volumes can be created until the existing usage drops below the `QuotaLimit`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Mediator none Sets the URL of the mediator for this pod, replacing the URL of the current mediator. By default, the Pure1 Cloud Mediator (`purestorage`) serves as the mediator. false False None
-MoveWithHostGroupName MoveWithHostGroupNames The host groups to be moved together with the pods to the specified local member realm or array. All the hosts in the host groups will also be moved. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-MoveWithHostName MoveWithHostNames The hosts to be moved together with the pods to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PodName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-PromoteFrom none (REST API 2.2+) The `undo-demote` pod that should be used to promote the pod. After the pod has been promoted, it will have the same data as the `undo-demote` pod and the `undo-demote` pod will be eradicated. false False None
-Quiesce none (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to demote the pod after the `pod-replica-link` goes into `quiesced` state and allow the pod to become a target of the remote pod. This ensures that all local data has been replicated to the remote pod before the pod is demoted. false False None
-QuotaLimit none The logical quota limit of the pod, measured in bytes. Must be a multiple of 512.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-RequestedPromotionState none (REST API 2.2+) Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `demoted` to demote the pod so that it can be used as a link target for continuous replication between pods. Demoted pods do not accept write requests, and a destroyed version of the pod with `undo-demote` appended to the pod name is created on the array with the state of the pod when it was in the promoted state. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `promoted` to start the process of promoting the pod. The `promotion_status` indicates when the pod has been successfully promoted. Promoted pods stop incorporating replicated data from the source pod and start accepting write requests. The replication process does not stop when the source pod continues replicating data to the pod. The space consumed by the unique replicated data is tracked by the `space.journal` field of the pod. false False None
-SkipQuiesce none (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to demote the pod without quiescing the `pod-replica-link` and allow the pod to become a target of the remote pod. This stops all pending replication to the remote pod. false False None
-ToMemberId ToMemberIds The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format. false False None
-ToMemberName ToMemberNames The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink

(REST API 2.2+) Modify pod replica links

Modifies pod replica links. The `LocalPodName` and `RemotePodName` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `Paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-Paused <Boolean>] [-RemoteId <List<String>>] [-RemoteName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-LocalPodId LocalPodIds A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodName` query parameter. false False None
-LocalPodName LocalPodNames A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodId` query parameter. false False None
-Paused none Returns a value of `$True` if the replica link is to be created in a `Paused` state. Returns a value of `$False` if the replica link is to be created not in a `Paused` state. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-RemoteId RemoteIds A list of remote array IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteName` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteName RemoteNames A list of remote array names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteId` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodId RemotePodIds A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodName` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodName RemotePodNames A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodId` query parameter. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLinkMappingPolicy

Modify policy mappings

Modifies policy mappings of a replica link. Valid `Mapping` values are `connected` and `disconnected`. `connected` indicates that the source policy and its attachments will be mirrored on the target pod. `disconnected` indicates that the associated policy and its attachments are independent from any policy on the remote. This operation can only be performed on the target side of a pod replica link.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLinkMappingPolicy [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-Mapping <String>] [-PodReplicaLinkId <List<String>>] [-RemoteId <List<String>>] [-RemoteName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-RemotePolicyId <List<String>>] [-RemotePolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-LocalPodId LocalPodIds A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodName` query parameter. false False None
-LocalPodName LocalPodNames A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodId` query parameter. false False None
-Mapping none The mapping to set on this policy mapping. Valid values are `connected` and `disconnected`. false False None
-PodReplicaLinkId PodReplicaLinkIds A list of pod replica link IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. false False None
-RemoteId RemoteIds A list of remote array IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteName` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteName RemoteNames A list of remote array names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteId` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodId RemotePodIds A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodName` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodName RemotePodNames A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodId` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePolicyId RemotePolicyIds A list of remote policy IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePolicyName` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePolicyName RemotePolicyNames A list of remote policy names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePolicyId` query parameter. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PolicyAutodir

Modify auto managed directory policies

Modifies one or more auto managed directory policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicyAutodir [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None

Update-Pfa2PolicyNfs

(REST API 2.3+) Modify NFS policies

Modifies one or more NFS policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicyNfs [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-NfsVersion <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-Security <List<String>>] [-UserMappingEnabled <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-NfsVersion none NFS protocol version allowed for the export to set for the policy. This operation updates all rules of the specified policy. Valid values are `nfsv3` and `nfsv4`. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-Security none The security flavors to use for accessing files on this mount point. Values include `auth_sys`, `krb5`, `krb5i`, and `krb5p`. If the server does not support the requested flavor, the mount operation fails. This operation updates all rules of the specified policy. If `auth_sys`, the client is trusted to specify the identity of the user. If `krb5`, cryptographic proof of the identity of the user is provided in each RPC request. This provides strong verification of the identity of users accessing data on the server. Note that additional configuration besides adding this mount option is required to enable Kerberos security. If `krb5i`, integrity checking is added to krb5. This ensures the data has not been tampered with. If `krb5p`, integrity checking and encryption is added to `krb5`. This is the most secure setting, but it also involves the most performance overhead. false False None
-UserMappingEnabled none (REST API 2.15+) If set to `$True`, FlashArray queries the joined AD/OpenLDAP server to find the user corresponding to the incoming UID. If set to `$False`, users are defined by UID/GID pair. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PolicyQuota

(REST API 2.7+) Modify quota policies

Modifies one or more quota policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicyQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule

(REST API 2.15+) Modify quota policy rules

Modifies quota policy rules.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RuleEnforced <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-RuleNotification <List<String>>] [-RuleQuotaLimit <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyId PolicyIds Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RuleEnforced RulesEnforced If set to `$True`, this rule describes an enforced quota. An out-of-space warning is issued if logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule. If set to `$False`, this rule describes an unenforced quota. Alerts and/or notifications are issued when logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule.


reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules		 false False None
-RuleNotification RulesNotifications Targets to notify when usage approaches the quota limit. The list of notification targets is a comma-separated string. Valid values are one or more of `user` and `group`. To notify no targets, use `none`.


reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules		 false False None
-RuleQuotaLimit RulesQuotaLimit Logical space limit of the quota (in bytes) assigned by the rule. This value cannot be set to 0.


reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules		 false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PolicySmb

(REST API 2.3+) Modify SMB policies

Modifies one or more SMB policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To enable access based enumeration, set `AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled=$True`. To disable access based enumeration, set `AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled=$False`. To enable continuous availability, set `continuous_availability=$True`. To disable continuous availability, set `continuous_availability=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicySmb [-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-ContinuousAvailabilityEnabled <Boolean>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, enables access based enumeration on the policy. When access based enumeration is enabled on a policy, files and folders within exports that are attached to the policy will be hidden from users who do not have permission to view them. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-ContinuousAvailabilityEnabled none If set to `$True`, enables continuous availability on the policy. When continuous availability is enabled on a policy, file shares are accessible during otherwise disruptive scenarios such as temporary network outages, controller upgrades or failovers. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. Enter multiple names. The name is expected to be fully qualified, meaning if the object is contained in some context, the corresponding name would provide complete information about the containment hierarchy. For example, `name01,pod01::name01`. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2PolicyUserGroupQuota

Modify user-group-quota policies

Modifies one or more user-group-quota policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PolicyUserGroupQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for user-group-quota management operations. If set to `$True`, user/group usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` of user-group-quota rules. If set to `$False`, the impact of the user-group-quota operation is checked against the user/group usage in the managed directory and its ancestors and the operation is not allowed if the user/group usage would exceed any enforced user-group-quota limits. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PolicyName PolicyNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Flag used to override checks for user-group-quota management operations. If set to `$True`, user/group usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` of user-group-quota rules. If set to `$False`, the impact of the user-group-quota operation is checked against the user/group usage in the managed directory and its ancestors and the operation is not allowed if the user/group usage would exceed any enforced user-group-quota limits. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

-PolicyName PolicyNames Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`. false False None
-RuleEnforced RulesEnforced If set to `$True`, the quota is enforced and an out-of-space warning is issued if logical space usage exceeds the specified limit. If set to `$False`, the quota is not enforced and alerts and/or notifications are issued when logical space usage exceeds the limit value. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotapatchRules		 false False None
-RuleNotification RulesNotifications Targets to notify when usage approaches or exceeds the quota limit. Valid non-empty values are `account` or `none`. The `account` value specifies that the user or group owning the usage will be notified, `none` specifies that notifications are not sent. If not specified, we assume `none`.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotapatchRules		 false False None
-RuleQuotaLimit RulesQuotaLimit Logical space limit of the quota (in bytes) assigned by the rule. This value cannot be negative.


reference: PolicyruleusergroupquotapatchRules		 false False None

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group

Modifies the protection group schedules to generate and replicate snapshots to another array or to an external storage system. Renames or destroys a protection group.

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup Aliases

  • Update-Pfa2PGroup

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupName <String>] [-ReplicationScheduleAt <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutEnd <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutStart <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-ReplicationScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-RetentionLock <String>] [-SnapshotScheduleAt <Int64>] [-SnapshotScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-SnapshotScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-SourceRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionDays <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPerPeriod <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPeriodLengthMs <Int64>] [-TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionDays <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerPeriod <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPeriodLengthMs <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None

If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none Has this protection group been destroyed? To destroy a protection group, patch to `$True`. To recover a destroyed protection group, patch to `$False`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None

Set `RetentionLock` to `ratcheted` to enable SafeMode restrictions on the protection group. Contact Pure Technical Services to change `RetentionLock` to `unlocked`. false False None

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group snapshot

Modifies a protection group snapshot so that it can be destroyed. To destroy a volume, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. The `Name` or `Id` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName <String>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `$True` if the protection group snapshot has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed snapshot is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed snapshot can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the snapshot is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-Suffix none (REST API 2.3+) The name suffix appended to the protection group name to make up the full protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If `Suffix` is not specified, the protection group name is in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `NNN` is a unique monotonically increasing number. If multiple protection group snapshots are created at a time, the suffix name is appended to those snapshots. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group target

Modifies the source array to replicate protection group data to the target, or disallows the source array from replicating protection group data to the target. The `Allowed` parameter must be set from the target array. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `Allowed` and `GroupName` parameters are required and must be set together. Offload targets do not support the `Allowed` parameter.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget [-Allowed <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-Allowed none If set to `$True`, the target array has allowed the source array to replicate protection group data to the target array. If set to `$False`, the target array has not allowed the source array to replicate protection group data to the target. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-GroupId GroupIds A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupName GroupNames Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberId MemberIds Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-MemberName MemberNames Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Realm

Modify realms

Modifies realm details.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Realm [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-QosBandwidthFloor <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsFloor <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-RealmName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-DestroyContents none Set to `$True` to destroy contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups), including eradicating containers with content. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, the realm will be destroyed and pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed realm is permanently eradicated. A realm can only be destroyed if it is empty or destroy_contents is set to $True. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed realm can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the realm is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-IgnoreUsage none Set to `$True` to set a `QuotaLimit` that is lower than the existing usage. This ensures that no new volumes can be created until the existing usage drops below the `QuotaLimit`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-QosBandwidthFloor none Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosIopsFloor none Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimit none Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QuotaLimit none The logical quota limit of the realm, measured in bytes.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-RealmName none The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a remote protection group

Modifies the snapshot retention schedule of a remote protection group. Also destroys a remote protection group from the offload target. Before the remote protection group can be destroyed, the offload target must first be removed from the protection group via the source array. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Id` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionDays <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerPeriod <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPeriodLengthMs <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `$True` if the remote protection group has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed remote protection group is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed remote protection group can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the remote protection group is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-TargetRetentionAllForSec none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionDays none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionPerDay none (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionPerPeriod none The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group. false False None
-TargetRetentionPeriodLengthMs none The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a remote protection group snapshot

Modifies a remote protection group snapshot, removing it from the offload target and destroying the snapshot. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Id` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.4+) Modify a remote volume snapshot

Modifies a remote volume snapshot by destroying or recovering it from the offload target. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-ReplicationSnapshot none If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2SmtpServer

(REST API 2.4+) Modify SMTP server attributes

Modifies SMTP server attributes. Values include `UserName`, `Password`, `RelayHost`, `SenderDomain`, `SenderUsername`, `SubjectPrefix`, `BodyPrefix`, `EncryptionMode`, and `SmtpName`.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2SmtpServer [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-BodyPrefix <String>] [-EncryptionMode <String>] [-Password <SecureString>] [-RelayHost <String>] [-SenderDomain <String>] [-SenderUsername <String>] [-SubjectPrefix <String>] [-UserName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-BodyPrefix none Optional string added to the beginning of the email body when sending alert email messages. HTML tags are not allowed. false False None
-EncryptionMode none Enforces an encryption mode when sending alert email messages. Valid values are `starttls`. Use "" to clear. false False None
-Password none Password for the relay host, if needed. false False None
-RelayHost none Relay server used as a forwarding point for email sent from the array. Can be set as a hostname, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address, with optional port numbers. The expected format for IPv4 is `ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd:PORT`. The expected format for IPv6 is `xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx` or, if a port number is specified, `[xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx]:PORT`. false False None
-SenderDomain none Domain name appended to alert email messages. false False None
-SenderUsername none The local-part of the email address used when sending alert email messages. false False None
-SubjectPrefix none Optional string added to the beginning of the subject when sending alert email messages. HTML tags are not allowed. false False None
-UserName UserNames User name for the relay host, if needed. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

  • None

Outputs

Update-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation

(REST API 2.3+) Modify software upgrade

Modifies a software upgrade by continuing, retrying, or aborting it. All `override_checks` are updated before the command is issued if `add_override_checks` is present. The `override_checks` parameter is valid when `Command` is set to `continue` or `retry`.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation [-AddOverrideChecksArgs <List<String>>] [-AddOverrideChecksName <List<String>>] [-AddOverrideChecksPersistent <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] -Command <String> -CurrentStepId <String> [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddOverrideChecksArgs none The name of the specific check within the override check to ignore so that the system can continue with the software upgrade. The `AddOverrideChecksName` parameter of the override check must be specified with the `AddOverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, if the HostIOCheck check fails on hosts host01 and host02, the system displays a list of these host names in the failed check. To override the HostIOCheck checks for host01 and host02, set `AddOverrideChecksName=HostIOCheck`, and set `AddOverrideChecksArgs=host01,host02`. Enter multiple `AddOverrideChecksArgs`. Note that not all checks have `AddOverrideChecksArgs` values.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-AddOverrideChecksName none The name of the upgrade check to be overridden so the software upgrade can continue if the check failed or is anticipated to fail during the upgrade process. Overriding the check forces the system to ignore the check failure and continue with the upgrade. If the check includes more specific checks that failed or are anticipated to fail, set them using the `AddOverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, the HostIOCheck check may include a list of hosts that have failed or are anticipated to fail the upgrade check.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-AddOverrideChecksPersistent none If set to `$True`, the system always ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check and continues with the upgrade process. If set to `$False`, the system ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check until the upgrade check finishes and the upgrade process is continued. For example, the `continue` command is successfully issued in an `interactive` mode, or the first upgrade check step successfully finishes in a `one-click` mode.


reference: OverrideCheck		 false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Command none A user command that interacts with the upgrade. Commands may only be issued when the upgrade is paused. Valid values are `continue`, `retry`, and `abort`. The `continue` command continues a `paused` upgrade. The `retry` command retries the previous step. The `abort` command aborts the upgrade. true False None
-CurrentStepId none The current step `id` of the installation. true False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Subnet

(REST API 2.2+) Modify subnet

Modifies one or more specified subnet properties.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Subnet [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Gateway <String>] [-Mtu <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Prefix <String>] [-SubnetName <String>] [-Vlan <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none Returns a value of `$True` if subnet is enabled. Returns a value of `$False` if subnet is disabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`. false False None
-Gateway none The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the gateway through which the specified subnet is to communicate with the network. false False None
-Mtu none Maximum message transfer unit (packet) size for the subnet in bytes. MTU setting cannot exceed the MTU of the corresponding physical interface. If not specified, defaults to `1500`.


minimum: 1280


maximum: 9216		 false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Prefix none The IPv4 or IPv6 address to be associated with the specified subnet. false False None
-SubnetName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-Vlan none VLAN ID number. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2Support

(REST API 2.2+) Create connection path

Creates a connection path from the array to another array.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Support [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-PhonehomeEnabled <Boolean>] [-PhonehomeExcludes <List<String>>] [-Proxy <String>] [-RemoteAssistActive <Boolean>] [-RemoteAssistDuration <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-PhonehomeEnabled none The status of phonehome. If set to `$True`, enable phonehome. If set to `$False`, disable phonehome. false False None
-PhonehomeExcludes none A list of of items to exclude form phonehome. Valid values include `application-insights`. false False None
-Proxy none The value of the current proxy, which is used for connecting to cloud services such as phonehome, remote assist, etc. Specify the server name, including the scheme and proxy port number. false False None
-RemoteAssistActive none The status of a remote assist session. If set to `$True`, enable the remote assist session. If set to `$False`, disable the remote assist session. false False None
-RemoteAssistDuration none Specifies the duration of the remote assist session in milliseconds. This parameter should only be provided when establishing a new session. This parameter determines the length of time the session will remain active after it is initiated. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2SyslogServer [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Service <List<String>>] [-Uri <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Service Services Valid values are `data-audit` and `management`. If not specified, defaults to `management`. false False None
-Uri Uris The URI of the syslog server in the format `PROTOCOL://HOSTNAME:PORT`. false False None
