  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2SyslogServerSetting

(REST API 2.4+) Modify syslog settings

Modifies syslog settings. Values include `continuation_token`, `items`, `more_items_remaining`, and `TotalItemCount`.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2SyslogServerSetting [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CaCertificate <String>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-LoggingSeverity <String>] [-TlsAuditEnabled <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CaCertificate none The certificate of the certificate authority (CA) that signed the directory servers' certificate(s), which is used to validate the authenticity of the configured servers. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-LoggingSeverity none (REST API 2.9+) Returns the configured logging severity threshold for which events will be forwarded to the configured syslog servers. Default configuration is info level severity. Valid values are `debug`, `info`, and `notice`. false False None
-TlsAuditEnabled none Returns a value of `$True` if messages that are necessary in order to audit TLS negotiations performed by the array are forwarded to the configured syslog servers. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Vchost

-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-VchostName VchostNames The new name of the vchost. false False None

Update-Pfa2VchostCertificate

Modify a vchost certificate

Modifies an existing vchost certificate. The `Id` query parameter alone, or the `CertificateName` query parameter together with one of `VchostName` or `VchostId`, is required.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VchostCertificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CertificateName <List<String>>] [-Endpoint <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-CertificateName CertificateNames The names of one or more certificates. Enter multiple names. For example, `cert01,cert02`. false False None
-Endpoint Endpoints The IPv4 or IPv6 addresses of the endpoints to configure for the vchost, over which the configured certificate will be presented. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-VchostId VchostIds Performs the operation on the unique vchost IDs specified. Enter multiple vchost IDs in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. false False None
-VchostName VchostNames Performs the operation on the unique vchost name specified. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Update-Pfa2VirtualMachine

(REST API 2.10+) Update a virtual machine

Updates a virtual machine, recovering it from the destroyed state. If the virtual machine is of type `vvol`, the `source` property of the request body must be a `recovery_context` value retrieved from the `Get-Pfa2VirtualMachine /virtual-machines` endpoint. If recovering the virtual machine will cause a conflict with an existing virtual machine, the operation will fail.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VirtualMachine [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-VmId <String>] [-VmType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Id Ids The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. `Id` is deprecated. Use `VmId` instead. false False None
-SourceId SourceIds The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified. false False None
-SourceName SourceNames The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified. false False None
-VmId VmIds (REST API 2.14+) The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. false False None
-VmType none The type of virtual machine. The only valid value is `vvol`. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Volume

(REST API 2.0+) Modify a volume

Modifies a volume by renaming, destroying, or resizing it. To rename a volume, set `VolumeName` to the new name. To destroy a volume, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. Set the bandwidth and IOPS limits of a volume through the respective `QosBandwidthLimit` and `QosIopsLimit` parameter. This moves the volume into a pod or volume group through the respective `pod` or `volume_group` parameter. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddToProtectionGroupIds none The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple ids. false False None
-AddToProtectionGroupNames none The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PodId none (REST API 2.3+) Moves the volume into the specified pod. false False None
-PodName none (REST API 2.3+) Moves the volume into the specified pod. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentOperator PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator (REST API 2.10+) Adjusts volume priority. Adjusts volume priority. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentValue PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue (REST API 2.10+) Adjusts volume priority. Adjusts volume priority. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion none Sets the properties that are specific to protocol endpoints. This can only be used in conjunction to `subtype=protocol_endpoint`. Sets the properties that are specific to protocol endpoints. This can only be used in conjunction to `subtype=protocol_endpoint`. false False None
-Provisioned none Updates the virtual size of the volume, measured in bytes.


maximum: 4503599627370496		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none (REST API 2.3+) Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume. false False False
-QosIopsLimit none (REST API 2.3+) Sets QoS limits. Sets QoS limits.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume. false False False
-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds none The volumes will be removed from the specified protection groups in the source pod or array along with the move. This can only be used when moving volumes across pods and arrays and must include all protection groups that the volumes are members of before the move. Enter multiple ids in a comma-separated format. false False None
-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames none The volumes will be removed from the specified protection groups in the source pod or array along with the move. This can only be used when moving volumes across pods and arrays and must include all protection groups that the volumes are members of before the move. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format. false False None
-RequestedPromotionState none (REST API 2.2+) Valid values are `promoted` and `demoted`. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `demoted` to demote the volume so that the volume stops accepting write requests. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `promoted` to promote the volume so that the volume starts accepting write requests. false False None
-Truncate none If set to `$True`, reduces the size of a volume during a volume resize operation. When a volume is truncated, Purity automatically takes an undo snapshot, providing a 24-hour window during which the previous contents can be retrieved. After truncating a volume, its provisioned size can be subsequently increased, but the data in truncated sectors cannot be retrieved. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the volume is being reduced in size, the volume copy operation fails. Required if the `Provisioned` parameter is set to a volume size that is smaller than the original size. false False None
-VolumeGroupId none (REST API 2.3+) Adds the volume to the specified volume group. false False None
-VolumeGroupName none (REST API 2.3+) Adds the volume to the specified volume group. false False None
-VolumeName VolumeNames The new name for the resource. false False None
-WorkloadId none Set the `PodId` or `VolumeName` of the workload to an empty string to remove the volume from the workload. false False None
-WorkloadName none Set the `PodId` or `VolumeName` of the workload to an empty string to remove the volume from the workload. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup

(REST API 2.1+) Modify a volume group

Modifies a volume group. You can rename, destroy, recover, or set QoS limits for a volume group. To rename a volume group, set `VolumeGroupName` to the new name. To destroy a volume group, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. Sets the bandwidth and IOPS limits of a volume group through the respective `QosBandwidthLimit` and `QosIopsLimit` parameter. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Sets the priority adjustment for a volume group using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator` and `PriorityAdjustmentValue` fields.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-DestroyContents none (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to destroy contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups), including eradicating containers with content. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `$True` if the volume group has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed volume group can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. After the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the volume group is permanently eradicated and cannot be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PriorityAdjustmentOperator PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator (REST API 2.10+) Valid values are `+`, `-`, and `=`. The values `+` and `-` may be applied to volumes and volume groups to reflect the relative importance of their workloads. Volumes and volume groups can be assigned a priority adjustment of -10, 0, or +10. In addition, volumes can be assigned values of =-10, =0, or =+10. Volumes with settings of -10, 0, +10 can be modified by the priority adjustment setting of a volume group that contains the volume. However, if a volume has a priority adjustment set with the `=` operator (for example, =+10), it retains that value and is unaffected by any volume group priority adjustment settings. false False None
-PriorityAdjustmentValue PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue (REST API 2.10+) Adjust priority by the specified amount, using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator`. Valid values are 0 and +10 for `+` and `-` operators, -10, 0, and +10 for the `=` operator. false False None
-QosBandwidthLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The maximum QoS bandwidth limit for the volume. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Maximum limit is 512 GB/s.


minimum: 1048576


maximum: 549755813888		 false False None
-QosBandwidthLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume group. false False False
-QosIopsLimit none (REST API 2.3+) The QoS IOPs limit for the volume.


minimum: 100


maximum: 100000000		 false False None
-QosIopsLimitReset none (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume group. false False False
-VolumeGroupName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot

(REST API 2.0+) Modify a volume snapshot

Modifies a volume snapshot by renaming, destroying, or recovering it. To rename the suffix of a volume snapshot, set `VolumeSnapshotName` to the new suffix name. To recover a volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$True`. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-VolumeSnapshotName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ReplicationSnapshot none (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`. false False None
-VolumeSnapshotName none The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Update-Pfa2Workload

Modify a workload

Modifies a workload by renaming or destroying it. To rename a workload, set `WorkloadName` to the new name. To destroy a workload, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a workload that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Workload [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextName <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ContextName ContextNames Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Id Ids Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Only one value is supported. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique resource names specified. Only one value is supported. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-WorkloadName none The new name for the resource. false False None
-XRequestId none {{ Fill XRequestId Description }} false False None
-ProgressAction proga {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }} false False None
